eng: the feeling of wanting or needing something
chisen: 他的性慾無度
engsen: his insatiable sexual appetite

eng: the feeling of wanting or needing something

engsen: I've read an excerpt of the book on the Web and it's whetted my appetite (= increased my interest in it) .

chi: （尤指透過書面或表格形式）申請，請求
eng: to request something, usually officially, especially in writing or by sending in a form
chisen: 我看到招聘廣告的時候，已經太晚了，錯過了應徵時機。
engsen: By the time I saw the job advertised it was already too late to apply .

chi: （尤指透過書面或表格形式）申請，請求
eng: to request something, usually officially, especially in writing or by sending in a form
chisen: 我已經申請了地方報紙的一個職位。
engsen: I've applied for a new job with the local newspaper .

chi: （尤指透過書面或表格形式）申請，請求
eng: to request something, usually officially, especially in writing or by sending in a form
chisen: 請將書面申請寄到以下地址。
engsen: Please apply in writing to the address below .

chi: （尤指透過書面或表格形式）申請，請求
eng: to request something, usually officially, especially in writing or by sending in a form
chisen: 我們已經向一個慈善組織提出申請，請求其對這個計劃提供資助。
engsen: We've applied to a charitable organization for a grant for the project .

chi: （尤指透過書面或表格形式）申請，請求
eng: to request something, usually officially, especially in writing or by sending in a form
chisen: 曼蒂已报名做警察。
engsen: Mandy applied to join the police .

chi: （尤指規章法律）適用，有關，涉及
eng: (especially of rules or laws) to have a connection or be important
chisen: 表格的那一項是給英國公民填的——和你無關。
engsen: That part of the form is for UK citizens - it doesn't apply to you .

chi: （尤指規章法律）適用，有關，涉及
eng: (especially of rules or laws) to have a connection or be important
chisen: 那些都是舊規定，不再適用了。
engsen: Those were old regulations - they don't apply any more .

eng: to make use of something or use it for a practical purpose
chisen: 他想找一份工作，可以用到他的多門外語知識。
engsen: He wants a job in which he can apply his foreign languages .

eng: to make use of something or use it for a practical purpose
chisen: 法庭聽司機陳述了他如何沒能及時刹車的原委。
engsen: The court heard how the driver had failed to apply his brakes in time .

eng: to make use of something or use it for a practical purpose
chisen: 如果你按壓住傷口，就會止住流血。
engsen: If you apply pressure to a cut it's meant to stop the bleeding .

eng: to spread or rub a substance such as cream or paint on a surface
chisen: 每三小時及游泳後將防曬霜充分塗抹於身體裸露部位。
engsen: Apply the cream liberally to exposed areas every three hours and after swimming .

eng: to spread or rub a substance such as cream or paint on a surface
chisen: 油漆應該薄薄地刷上一層，且要刷得均勻。
engsen: The paint should be applied thinly and evenly .

eng: If you apply yourself to something, you work hard at it, directing your abilities and efforts in a determined way so that you succeed.
chisen: 如果你努力，任何問題都能解決。
engsen: You can solve any problem if you apply yourself .

eng: to speak angrily to someone, telling that person that you disagree with them
chisen: 孩子老是吵個不停。
engsen: The children are always arguing .

eng: to speak angrily to someone, telling that person that you disagree with them
chisen: 孩子們，你們別再吵嘴了好不好？
engsen: Kids , will you stop arguing with each other ?

eng: to speak angrily to someone, telling that person that you disagree with them
chisen: 他們正在爭論去看哪部電影。
engsen: They were arguing over/about which film to go and see .

eng: to give the reasons for your opinion, idea, belief, etc.
chisen: 部長提出支持／反對削減軍費開支的理由。
engsen: The senator argued for/in favour of/against making cuts in military spending .

eng: to give the reasons for your opinion, idea, belief, etc.
chisen: 部長論證了削減軍費開支的必要性。
engsen: The senator argued that cuts in military spending were needed .

eng: to give the reasons for your opinion, idea, belief, etc.
chisen: 這件事正說反說都有道理。
engsen: You can argue the case either way .

eng: to show that something is true or exists
chisen: 證據顯示政策有了變動。
engsen: The evidence argues a change in policy .

eng: a disagreement, or the process of disagreeing
chisen: 那群孩子為了玩哪個遊戲吵了起來。
engsen: The children had an argument about/over what game to play .

eng: a disagreement, or the process of disagreeing
chisen: 昨晚他和傑夫在酒館裡起了爭執。
engsen: He got into an argument with Jeff in the pub last night .

eng: a disagreement, or the process of disagreeing
chisen: 經過激烈的爭辯，最終作出了一項決定。
engsen: A decision was finally made after some heated argument .

chi: 理由，論據，論點；論證，說理
eng: a reason or reasons why you support or oppose an idea or suggestion, or the process of explaining these reasons
chisen: 既然支持和反對這項提議的所有理由我們都已經聽過了，現在投票表決吧。
engsen: Now that we've heard all the arguments for and against the proposal , let's vote on it .

chi: 理由，論據，論點；論證，說理
eng: a reason or reasons why you support or oppose an idea or suggestion, or the process of explaining these reasons
chisen: 她提出理由說他們需要一個比較大的房子，但是她的丈夫沒有被說服。
engsen: Her husband was not convinced by her argument that they needed a bigger house .

chi: 理由，論據，論點；論證，說理
eng: a reason or reasons why you support or oppose an idea or suggestion, or the process of explaining these reasons
chisen: 我認為這個論點不太站得住腳／令人信服／有說服力。
engsen: I don't think that's a very strong/convincing/powerful argument .

chi: 理由，論據，論點；論證，說理
eng: a reason or reasons why you support or oppose an idea or suggestion, or the process of explaining these reasons
chisen: 這本書的中心論點是，有幾個劇本並非出自莎士比亞之手。
engsen: The central argument (= main point) of the book is that some of the plays were not written by Shakespeare .

eng: either of the two long parts of the upper body that are attached to the shoulders and have the hands at the end
chisen: 提這個袋子累得我胳膊疼。
engsen: My arms ache from carrying this bag .

eng: either of the two long parts of the upper body that are attached to the shoulders and have the hands at the end
chisen: 她伸出雙臂擁抱我。
engsen: She put/threw her arms round me and gave me a hug .

eng: either of the two long parts of the upper body that are attached to the shoulders and have the hands at the end
chisen: 他把她摟進懷中。
engsen: He took/held her in his arms (= held her closely) .

eng: either of the two long parts of the upper body that are attached to the shoulders and have the hands at the end
chisen: 比爾挽著新女友一起來到聚會上。
engsen: Bill arrived at the party with his new girlfriend on his arm (= her hand resting on his arm) .

eng: weapons and equipment used to kill and injure people
chisen: 他們被指控向遊擊隊提供軍火。
engsen: They have been charged with supplying arms to the guerrillas .

eng: weapons and equipment used to kill and injure people
chisen: 在南威爾士發現了一個秘密軍火庫。
engsen: An arms cache was discovered in South Wales .

eng: weapons and equipment used to kill and injure people
chisen: 部長要求恐怖分子放下武器。
engsen: The minister has called on the terrorists to lay down their arms (= stop fighting) .

eng: weapons and equipment used to kill and injure people
chisen: 在必要時，他們會隨時拿起武器（對抗政府）。
engsen: They are willing to take up arms (= prepare to fight) (against the government) if they have to .

chi: 職能部門；分支機構，分部
eng: An arm of an organization is a part of it that is responsible for a particular activity or place.
chisen: 這家英國公司是一家龐大的跨國公司的分部。
engsen: The British company is one arm of a large multinational .

eng: a comfortable chair with sides that support your arms
chisen: 她坐在火爐旁的扶手椅上看報紙。
engsen: She sat in an armchair by the fire , reading a newspaper .

eng: to plan, prepare for, or organize something
chisen: 我正設法把工作安排好，以便下週能夠休息兩天。
engsen: I'm trying to arrange my work so that I can have a couple of days off next week .

eng: to plan, prepare for, or organize something
chisen: 會議已經安排在週三了。
engsen: The meeting has been arranged for Wednesday .

eng: to plan, prepare for, or organize something
chisen: 他們約好在下個月共進晚餐。
engsen: They arranged to have dinner the following month .

eng: to plan, prepare for, or organize something
chisen: 我已和他約好了在電影院見面。
engsen: I've already arranged with him to meet at the cinema .

eng: to plan, prepare for, or organize something
chisen: 她已經安排她兒子去上游泳課了。
engsen: She's arranged for her son to have swimming lessons .

eng: to plan, prepare for, or organize something
chisen: 我特意安排好讓他們同時到達。
engsen: I'd deliberately arranged that they should arrive at the same time .

eng: to plan, prepare for, or organize something
chisen: 我們還沒有約好甚麼時候會面。
engsen: We haven't yet arranged when to meet .

chi: 整理，使有條理；排列；佈置
eng: to put a group of objects in a particular order
chisen: 她把生日卡在架子上擺成一排。
engsen: She arranged her birthday cards along the shelf .

chi: 整理，使有條理；排列；佈置
eng: to put a group of objects in a particular order
chisen: 這些花插得真漂亮，誰的手藝？
engsen: Who arranged these flowers so beautifully ?

chi: 整理，使有條理；排列；佈置
eng: to put a group of objects in a particular order
chisen: 他的書都按照字母順序排列得整整齊齊。
engsen: His books are neatly arranged in alphabetical order .

eng: to make changes to a piece of music so that it can be played in a different way, for example by a particular instrument
chisen: 貝多芬的第五號交響曲被改編成了鋼琴曲。
engsen: Beethoven's fifth symphony has been arranged for the piano .

eng: a plan for how something will happen
chisen: 他們為聚會作好了一切準備。
engsen: They'd made all the arrangements for the party .

eng: a plan for how something will happen
chisen: 已經作出安排將犯人轉至另一監獄。
engsen: Arrangements were made to move the prisoners to another jail .

eng: a plan for how something will happen
chisen: 目前你的孩子怎麼照顧？
engsen: What are your current childcare arrangements ?

eng: a group of objects that have been put in a particular order or position
chisen: 桌上乾花的插花樣式非常引人注目。
engsen: There was a striking arrangement of dried flowers on the table .

eng: a piece of music that has had changes made to it so that it can be played in a different way, especially by different instruments
chisen: 這首新改編的樂曲是供薩克斯風和鋼琴演奏的。
engsen: This new arrangement of the piece is for saxophone and piano .

eng: If the police arrest someone, they take them away to ask them about a crime that they might have committed.
chisen: 海關人員在他的手提包裡發現了毒品，把他拘捕了。
engsen: He was arrested when customs officers found drugs in his bag .

eng: If the police arrest someone, they take them away to ask them about a crime that they might have committed.
chisen: 她因酒後駕車被警方拘捕。
engsen: The police arrested her for drinking and driving .

eng: to stop or interrupt the development of something
chisen: 這種療法到目前為止幾乎沒有抑制癌細胞的擴散。
engsen: The treatment has so far done little to arrest the spread of the cancer .

eng: to attract or catch someone's attention
chisen: 一張小男孩的照片引起了我的注意。
engsen: A photo of a small boy arrested my attention .

chi: 到達，抵達（尤指到達旅途的終點）；到來；來臨
eng: to reach a place, especially at the end of a journey
chisen: 你坐的火車甚麼時候到？
engsen: What time will your train arrive ?

chi: 到達，抵達（尤指到達旅途的終點）；到來；來臨
eng: to reach a place, especially at the end of a journey
chisen: 我們到站時，天都已經黑了。
engsen: It was dark by the time we arrived at the station .

chi: 到達，抵達（尤指到達旅途的終點）；到來；來臨
eng: to reach a place, especially at the end of a journey
chisen: 我們在那天晚些時候到達布拉格。
engsen: We arrived in Prague later that day .

chi: 到達，抵達（尤指到達旅途的終點）；到來；來臨
eng: to reach a place, especially at the end of a journey
chisen: 我回到家時，發現家裡失竊了。
engsen: I arrived back to find that my room had been burgled .

chi: 到達，抵達（尤指到達旅途的終點）；到來；來臨
eng: to reach a place, especially at the end of a journey
chisen: 郵件一般甚麼時候到？
engsen: What time does the mail usually arrive (= is it delivered) ?

chi: 到達，抵達（尤指到達旅途的終點）；到來；來臨
eng: to reach a place, especially at the end of a journey
chisen: 我在一個多月前訂購了幾張CD，但是現在還沒有送來。
engsen: I ordered some CDs over a month ago , but they still haven't arrived (= I have not received them) .

eng: to happen or start to exist
chisen: 樹葉開始變黃，是秋天到來的前兆。
engsen: The leaves starting to turn brown is a sign that autumn has arrived .

eng: a weapon that is like a long, thin stick with a sharp point at one end and often feathers at the other, shot from a bow (= a long, thin piece of wood bent into a curve by a piece of string)
chisen: 羅賓漢讓人們把他安葬在他的箭落下的位置。
engsen: Robin Hood asked to be buried where his arrow landed .

chi: （報紙或雜誌上的）文章，報導；論文
eng: a piece of writing on a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine, or on the internet
chisen: 昨天報紙上登了一篇關於素食主義的有趣文章。
engsen: There was an interesting article on vegetarianism in the paper yesterday .

chi: （尤指同一類的或在一起的數個中的一件）物品，物件；物品的一件
eng: a particular thing, especially one that is one of several things of a similar type or in the same place
chisen: 建議房客不要將任何貴重物品放在飯店房間裡。
engsen: Guests are advised not to leave any articles of value in their hotel rooms .

chi: （尤指同一類的或在一起的數個中的一件）物品，物件；物品的一件
eng: a particular thing, especially one that is one of several things of a similar type or in the same place
chisen: 有人在河邊發現了一件衣服。
engsen: An article of clothing was found near the river .

chi: （尤指同一類的或在一起的數個中的一件）物品，物件；物品的一件
eng: a particular thing, especially one that is one of several things of a similar type or in the same place
chisen: 幾件傢俱
engsen: articles of furniture

eng: a separate part in a written document such as a legal agreement
chisen: 東德和西德按照波恩憲法第23條實現了統一。
engsen: East and West Germany united under article 23 of the Bonn constitution .

chi: （尤指學生寫的作爲課程作業的）短文；論說文；小品文，散文
eng: a short piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one done by students as part of the work for a course
chisen: 我想讓你們寫一篇關於瀕危物種的文章作爲作業。
engsen: For homework I want you to write an essay on endangered species .

chi: （尤指學生寫的作爲課程作業的）短文；論說文；小品文，散文
eng: a short piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one done by students as part of the work for a course
chisen: 瓊斯先生認為我的歷史作業論文寫得好極了。
engsen: Mr Jones thought my history essay was terrific .

chi: 藝術家；美術家；畫家；雕塑家
eng: someone who paints, draws, or makes sculptures
chisen: 莫內是我最喜歡的畫家之一。
engsen: Monet is one of my favourite artists .

eng: sleeping or not awake
chisen: 真奇怪，你怎麼醒了——十分鐘前你還睡得很甜呢。
engsen: I'm surprised to see you awake - ten minutes ago you were fast/sound (= completely) asleep .

eng: sleeping or not awake
chisen: 我剛起床，還沒完全醒呢。
engsen: I've only just got up and I'm still half asleep (= not completely awake) .

eng: someone who helps someone else to do a job
chisen: 行政／辦公室助理
engsen: an administrative/office assistant

eng: someone who helps someone else to do a job
chisen: 助理編輯／經理
engsen: an assistant editor/manager

eng: to try to hurt or defeat using violence
chisen: 他被一幫年輕人打成重傷。
engsen: He was attacked and seriously injured by a gang of youths .

eng: to try to hurt or defeat using violence
chisen: 從拂曉開始，軍隊就對這個城市展開了進攻。
engsen: Army forces have been attacking the town since dawn .

eng: to try to hurt or defeat using violence
chisen: 大多數野生動物若非被激怒，是不會主動攻擊的。
engsen: Most wild animals won't attack unless they are provoked .

eng: to criticize someone strongly
chisen: 她寫了一篇文章抨擊法官以及他們的審案方式。
engsen: She wrote an article attacking the judges and their conduct of the trial .

eng: to criticize someone strongly
chisen: 這篇報導抨擊了對七八歲的孩子進行考試的計劃。
engsen: The report attacks the idea of exams for seven and eight-year-olds .

chi: （疾病、化學品等）侵襲；侵害；侵蝕
eng: If something, such as a disease or a chemical, attacks something, it damages it.
chisen: 愛滋病破壞人體的免疫系統。
engsen: AIDS attacks the body's immune system .

chi: （疾病、化學品等）侵襲；侵害；侵蝕
eng: If something, such as a disease or a chemical, attacks something, it damages it.
chisen: 我的薔薇花叢正在遭受蚜蟲的侵害。
engsen: My rose bushes are being attacked by aphids .

chi: 迅速處理；高效解決；全力應付
eng: to deal with something quickly and in an effective way
chisen: 我們必須現在就處理這些問題並尋找解決方案。
engsen: We have to attack these problems now and find some solutions .

chi: 迅速處理；高效解決；全力應付
eng: to deal with something quickly and in an effective way
chisen: 孩子們衝進屋裡狼吞虎嚥地大吃起來。
engsen: The children rushed in and eagerly attacked the food (= quickly started to eat it) .

eng: to go to an event, place, etc.
chisen: 二百多人參加了葬禮。
engsen: Over two hundred people attended the funeral .

eng: to go to an event, place, etc.
chisen: 會議將在5號舉行，我們希望大家都能出席。
engsen: The meeting is on the fifth and we're hoping everyone will attend .

eng: to give attention to what someone is saying
chisen: 恐怕我沒注意聽說了些甚麼。
engsen: I'm afraid I wasn't attending to what was being said .

chi: （尤指作為工作）服侍；陪同；看護，照顧
eng: to provide a service to someone, especially as part of your job
chisen: 公主由其女侍臣隨從侍候。
engsen: The queen was attended by her ladies-in-waiting .

chi: 伴隨…而至；（作為結果）伴隨
eng: to happen as a result of, and at the same time as
chisen: 從事電視行業必然帶來的拋頭露面
engsen: the publicity that attends a career in television

eng: notice, thought, or interest
chisen: 女士們、先生們，請大家注意一下好嗎？
engsen: Ladies and gentlemen , could I have your attention , please ?

eng: notice, thought, or interest
chisen: 他們正在組織一場運動，目的是使人們意識到開車對環境造成的危害。
engsen: They're organizing a campaign to draw people's attention to the environmentally harmful effects of using their cars .

eng: notice, thought, or interest
chisen: 等一下，過一會兒我就可以全神貫注聽你說了。
engsen: Wait a moment and I'll give you my full/undivided attention (= I'll listen to and think about only you) .

eng: notice, thought, or interest
chisen: 一小時後，我開始分神了。
engsen: After an hour , my attention started to wander (= I stopped taking notice) .

eng: special care or treatment
chisen: 油漆工作需要特別下些功夫。
engsen: The paintwork will need a little attention .

eng: special care or treatment
chisen: 如果症狀不減輕，請馬上就醫。
engsen: If symptoms persist , seek medical attention .

eng: (especially in the armed forces) a way of standing, with the feet together, arms by your sides, head up, and shoulders back, and not moving
chisen: 立正站立的士兵
engsen: soldiers standing at/to attention

eng: to stay away from someone or something
chisen: 我儘量避開週六去超級市場——那時總是人特別多。
engsen: I try to avoid supermarkets on Saturdays - they're always so busy .

eng: to stay away from someone or something
chisen: 在交通高峰時段，我對高速公路唯恐避之不及。
engsen: I'm anxious to avoid the motorway at rush hour .

eng: to stay away from someone or something
chisen: 你認為盧卡斯是不是在躲著我啊？我一整天都沒見到他。
engsen: Do you think Lukas is avoiding me ? I haven't seen him all day .

eng: not advanced
chisen: 小時候，老師認為他愚笨遲鈍。
engsen: When he was a child , his teachers thought he was backward (= unable to learn as much as most children) .

eng: not advanced
chisen: 人們仍然認為這是一個落後的國家／區域／地區。
engsen: People still think of it as a backward country/region/area (= one without industry or modern machines) .

chi: 向後的；與面對方向相反的
eng: towards the direction that is the opposite to the one in which you are facing
chisen: 她頭也不回地離去了。
engsen: She left without a backward glance .

chi: 向後的；與面對方向相反的
eng: towards the direction that is the opposite to the one in which you are facing
chisen: 他做了一個漂亮的後空翻。

a 
cell phone

engsen: a bar of chocolate

engsen: It was a choice between pain now or pain later , so I chose pain later .

engsen: Now you know all the facts , you can make an informed choice .

eng: an act or the possibility of choosing

engsen: The evening menu offers a wide choice of dishes .

chi: 可供選擇的東西；選擇範圍

engsen: The dress is available in a choice of colours .

engsen: He wouldn't be my choice as a friend .

chi: 入選者；被選中的東西；選項

engsen: This type of day care may in fact be the best choice for your child .

engsen: She had to choose between the two men in her life .

engsen: Danny , come here and choose your ice cream .

engsen: It's difficult choosing where to live .

eng: a continuous curved line, the points of which are always the same distance away from a fixed central point, or the area inside such a line

eng: a group of people with family, work, or social connections

engsen: She's not one of my close circle of friends .

eng: a group of people with family, work, or social connections

engsen: We never meet these days - we move in different circles (= do not have the same group of friends) .

eng: an upper floor in a theatre or cinema where people sit to watch the performance

eng: a person who is a member of a particular country and who has rights because of being born there or because of being given rights, or a person who lives in a particular town or city

engsen: The interests of British citizens living abroad are protected by the British Embassy .

eng: a person who is a member of a particular country and who has rights because of being born there or because of being given rights, or a person who lives in a particular town or city

engsen: He applied to become an American citizen .

eng: a person who is a member of a particular country and who has rights because of being born there or because of being given rights, or a person who lives in a particular town or city
chisen: 今天早上，莫斯科市民一覺醒來發現他們有了一個新政府。
engsen: The citizens of Moscow woke up this morning to find they had a new government .

eng: a person who is a member of a particular country and who has rights because of being born there or because of being given rights, or a person who lives in a particular town or city

engsen: Old people are just treated like second-class citizens (= unimportant people) .

eng: a person who is a member of a particular country and who has rights because of being born there or because of being given rights, or a person who lives in a particular town or city

engsen: He reassured people that law-abiding citizens (= people who do not break the law) would have nothing to fear from the enquiries .

eng: to say that something is true or is a fact, although you cannot prove it and other people might not believe it

engsen: The company claims (that) it is not responsible for the pollution in the river .

engsen: He claims to have met the president , but I don't believe him .

eng: to say that something is true or is a fact, although you cannot prove it and other people might not believe it

engsen: All parties have claimed success in yesterday's elections .

eng: to say that something is true or is a fact, although you cannot prove it and other people might not believe it

chisen: 我嫂子和我差不多同時生了孩子，因此這對表兄妹年紀相若。
engsen: My brother's wife and I both had babies around the same time , so the cousins are very close in age .

chi: 堂（或表）兄弟；堂（或表）姐妹；遠房親戚
eng: a child of a person's aunt or uncle, or, more generally, a distant (= not close) relation
chisen: 我們家許多多年未見的遠房親戚趕來參加姐姐的婚禮。
engsen: Many of our distant cousins , whom we hadn't seen for years , came to my sister's wedding .

eng: a sea creature with five pairs of legs and a round, flat body covered by a shell, or its flesh eaten as food
chisen: 我們沿著海灘走，一路撿拾小螃蟹。
engsen: We walked along the beach collecting small crabs .

eng: a sea creature with five pairs of legs and a round, flat body covered by a shell, or its flesh eaten as food

engsen: All the shops on the seafront had crab for sale .

eng: a sea creature with five pairs of legs and a round, flat body covered by a shell, or its flesh eaten as food
chisen: 這份蟹肉／蟹肉色沙拉味道好極了！
engsen: This crab meat/salad is delicious !

eng: a tall metal structure with a long horizontal part, used for lifting and moving heavy objects

engsen: The crane lifted the container off the ship .

eng: stupid or not reasonable

engsen: It's a crazy idea .

engsen: You're crazy to buy a house without seeing it .

eng: annoyed or angry

engsen: The constant noise drove me crazy (= made me become angry) .

eng: the thick, yellowish-white liquid that forms on the top of milk

engsen: strawberries and cream

eng: the thick, yellowish-white liquid that forms on the top of milk

engsen: Do you like cream in your coffee ?

eng: the thick, yellowish-white liquid that forms on the top of milk

engsen: a cream cake (= cake with cream in it)

eng: to make something new, or invent something

engsen: Charles Schulz created the characters "Snoopy" and "Charlie Brown" .

eng: to make something new, or invent something

engsen: The Bible says that God created the world .

eng: to make something new, or invent something

engsen: He created a wonderful meal from very few ingredients .

eng: to make something new, or invent something

engsen: If she sees you with an ice cream she'll only start creating .

eng: illegal activities

eng: illegal activities

engsen: petty (= unimportant) crime/serious crime

eng: a time of great disagreement, confusion, or suffering

engsen: The country's leadership is in crisis .

eng: a time of great disagreement, confusion, or suffering

engsen: an economic/financial crisis

eng: a time of great disagreement, confusion, or suffering

engsen: We have a family crisis on my hands - my 16-year-old sister is pregnant .

eng: (the total amount collected of) a plant such as a grain, fruit, or vegetable grown in large amounts

engsen: The main crops grown for export are coffee and rice .

eng: (the total amount collected of) a plant such as a grain, fruit, or vegetable grown in large amounts

engsen: a bumper (= very good) potato crop

chi: （同時湧現的）一批，一幫（人或事物）

engsen: The judges will select the best from this year's crop of first novels .

eng: a short hairstyle
chisen: 她留著很短的平頭。
engsen: Her hair was cut in a short crop .

eng: to go across from one side of something to the other

engsen: It's not a good place to cross the road .

eng: to go across from one side of something to the other
chisen: 過馬路前先要左右看看。
engsen: Look both ways before you cross over (= cross the road) .

eng: to go across from one side of something to the other
chisen: 過橋後右轉。
engsen: Cross the bridge and turn right .

eng: to go across from one side of something to the other
chisen: 他們穿越阿爾巴尼亞進入了希臘。
engsen: They crossed from Albania into Greece .

eng: to put one of your arms, fingers, or legs over the top of the other
chisen: 她坐下蹺起了二郎腿。
engsen: She sat down and crossed her legs .

eng: to annoy someone by not doing or saying what they want
chisen: 如果我是你就不會跟他作對，除非不想活了。
engsen: I wouldn't cross him if I were you , not if you value your life .

eng: in some sports, to hit, kick, or throw the ball across the playing area to another player, not forwards or backwards
chisen: 他把球橫傳給不萊梅，可是不知怎麼的不萊梅兩米外射門卻沒有射中。
engsen: He crossed (the ball) to Bremer , who somehow failed to score from two metres out .

chi: 在（支票中間）上畫兩道線（表示需要轉入銀行帳戶）

eng: a large group of people who have come together

engsen: A crowd of about 15,000 attended the concert .

chi: 殘忍的；殘酷的；刻毒傷人的
eng: extremely unkind and unpleasant and causing pain to people or animals intentionally
chisen: 別拿他的體重開玩笑——這樣太刻薄了。
engsen: Don't tease him about his weight - it's cruel .

chi: 殘忍的；殘酷的；刻毒傷人的
eng: extremely unkind and unpleasant and causing pain to people or animals intentionally
chisen: 小孩相互之間會很殘忍。
engsen: Children can be very cruel to each other .

chi: 文化（尤指某一群體在某一時期普遍的風俗習慣和信仰）
eng: the way of life, especially the general customs and beliefs, of a particular group of people at a particular time

engsen: She's studying modern Japanese language and culture .

eng: music, art, theatre, literature, etc.

engsen: You won't find much culture in this sleepy little town , I'm afraid !

eng: music, art, theatre, literature, etc.

engsen: At one time doctors couldn't cure TB/cure people of TB .

eng: interested in learning about people or things around you

engsen: I was curious to know what would happen next .

eng: interested in learning about people or things around you

engsen: Babies are curious about everything around them .

chi: 稀奇的，古怪的，不尋常的

chi: 稀奇的，古怪的，不尋常的
eng: strange and unusual

engsen: It's curious (that) Billy hasn't phoned when he promised he would .

eng: a piece of material, especially cloth, that hangs across a window or opening to make a room or part of a room dark or private

engsen: to draw (= open or close) the curtains

eng: a way of behaving or a belief that has been established for a long time

engsen: a local/ancient custom

engsen: In my country , it's the custom (for women) to get married in white .

eng: the support given to a business, especially a shop, by the people who buy things or services from it

engsen: Most of our custom comes from tourists nowadays .

eng: the support given to a business, especially a shop, by the people who buy things or services from it

engsen: If we don't give good service , people will take their custom elsewhere .

eng: the place at a port, airport, or border where travellers' bags are looked at to find out if any goods are being carried illegally

engsen: to go through customs

eng: a person who buys goods or a service

engsen: a satisfied customer

engsen: Mrs Wilson is one of our regular customers .

eng: happening on or relating to every day

eng: happening on or relating to every day

engsen: We back up our computer files at work on a daily basis .

eng: happening on or relating to every day

engsen: She's looking forward to retiring and ending the daily grind (= hard , boring work or duty) of working in an office .

eng: to harm or spoil something

eng: to harm or spoil something

engsen: It was a scandal that damaged a lot of reputations .

chi: 危險的，有威脅的；不安全的
eng: A dangerous person, animal, thing, or activity could harm you.

engsen: The men are armed and dangerous .

chi: 危險的，有威脅的；不安全的

chisen: 他的父母不讓他打冰球，因為他們認為太危險。
engsen: His parents won't let him play ice hockey because they think it's too dangerous .

chi: 危險的，有威脅的；不安全的
eng: A dangerous person, animal, thing, or activity could harm you.

engsen: It's dangerous to take more than the recommended dose .

eng: information, especially facts or numbers, collected to be examined and considered and used to help decision-making, or information in an electronic form that can be stored and used by a computer

engsen: The data was/were collected by various researchers .

eng: information, especially facts or numbers, collected to be examined and considered and used to help decision-making, or information in an electronic form that can be stored and used by a computer

eng: the period in the day when light from the sun begins to appear in the sky

eng: the period in the day when light from the sun begins to appear in the sky

engsen: We left as dawn was breaking (= starting) .

eng: the period in the day when light from the sun begins to appear in the sky

engsen: We left at the break of dawn .

chi: 耳聾的，聽不見的，失聰的

eng: (a) serious discussion of a subject in which many people take part

eng: (a) serious discussion of a subject in which many people take part

eng: something, especially money, that is owed to someone else, or the state of owing something

eng: something, especially money, that is owed to someone else, or the state of owing something

eng: something, especially money, that is owed to someone else, or the state of owing something

eng: something, especially money, that is owed to someone else, or the state of owing something

eng: something, especially money, that is owed to someone else, or the state of owing something

eng: a choice that you make about something after thinking about several possibilities

engsen: She has had to make some very difficult decisions .

eng: a choice that you make about something after thinking about several possibilities

engsen: The company will reach/come to/make a decision shortly .

eng: a choice that you make about something after thinking about several possibilities

engsen: Let me have a/your decision (= tell me what you have decided) by next week .

eng: a choice that you make about something after thinking about several possibilities

engsen: It was his decision to leave .

eng: a choice that you make about something after thinking about several possibilities

engsen: This job demands a high degree of skill .

eng: (an) amount or level of something

engsen: The number of terrorist attacks has increased to a terrifying degree .

eng: (an) amount or level of something

engsen: There was some degree of truth in what she said .

eng: (an) amount or level of something

engsen: To what degree do you think we will be providing a better service ?

eng: (an) amount or level of something

chi: 度，度數（尤指溫度或角度的度量單位，通常在數字後用符號 °來表示）

eng: a course of study at a college or university, or the qualification given to a student after he or she has completed his or her studies

engsen: She has a bachelor's/master's degree in history from Yale .

eng: a course of study at a college or university, or the qualification given to a student after he or she has completed his or her studies

engsen: "What degree did you do at York?" "Geography."

eng: to make something happen at a later time than originally planned or expected

engsen: My plane was delayed by an hour .

eng: to make something happen at a later time than originally planned or expected

engsen: Heavy snow delayed the start of the game .

eng: to make something happen at a later time than originally planned or expected

engsen: I think we should delay deciding about this until next year .

chi: 美味的；（味道或氣味）誘人的
eng: having a very pleasant taste or smell

engsen: a delicious cake

chi: 美味的；（味道或氣味）誘人的
eng: having a very pleasant taste or smell

engsen: The delicious smell of freshly made coffee came from the kitchen .

chi: 美味的；（味道或氣味）誘人的
eng: having a very pleasant taste or smell
chisen: 這種酒味道很好。
engsen: This wine is delicious .

eng: to take goods, letters, parcels, etc. to people's houses or places of work

engsen: Mail is delivered to our office twice a day .

eng: to take goods, letters, parcels, etc. to people's houses or places of work

engsen: The furniture store is delivering our new bed on Thursday .

eng: to give, direct, or aim something

engsen: The priest delivered a passionate sermon/speech against war .

eng: to give, direct, or aim something

engsen: The jury delivered a verdict of not guilty .

eng: to give, direct, or aim something

engsen: The police said that it was the blow delivered (= given) to her head that killed her .

eng: to give, direct, or aim something

engsen: The pitcher tripped as he delivered the ball (= threw it towards the person with the bat) .

eng: to achieve or produce something that has been promised

engsen: The government has failed to deliver (what it promised) .

eng: to achieve or produce something that has been promised

engsen: The Republicans are relying on their agricultural policies to deliver the farmers' vote (= to persuade farmers to vote for them) .

eng: to (help) give birth to a baby

engsen: She delivered her third child at home .

eng: to (help) give birth to a baby

engsen: The baby was delivered by a midwife .

eng: to (help) give birth to a baby

engsen: The princess has been delivered of (= has given birth to) a healthy baby boy .

eng: to save someone from a painful or bad experience

engsen: Is there nothing that can be done to deliver these starving people from their suffering ?

eng: a person whose job is treating people's teeth

engsen: You should have your teeth checked by a dentist at least twice a year .

engsen: He will not confirm or deny the allegations .

engsen: Neil denies that he broke the window , but I'm sure he did .

eng: to say that something is not true
chisen: 尼爾不承認是他打破了窗戶。

eng: to not allow someone to have or do something

engsen: Her request for time off work was denied .

engsen: No one should be denied a good education./A good education should be denied to no one .

eng: to not allow someone to have or do something

engsen: The goalkeeper denied him his third goal .

eng: to not allow someone to have or do something

eng: to not admit that you have knowledge, responsibility, feelings, etc.

engsen: Everything he says has a double meaning (= has two possible meanings) .

eng: twice the size, amount, price, etc., or consisting of two similar things together
chisen: 這種止痛藥具有雙倍功效。
engsen: This painkiller is double strength (= has twice the normal amount of medicine) .

eng: twice the size, amount, price, etc., or consisting of two similar things together
chisen: 薩比哈的電話號碼是331577。
engsen: Sabiha's phone number is double three , one , five , double seven (= 331577) .

chi: （尤指對好壞、真實性的）懷疑，疑慮，疑問
eng: (a feeling of) not being certain about something, especially about how good or true it is
chisen: 我對他是否能勝任此項工作還有一些疑問。
engsen: I'm having doubts about his ability to do the job .

chi: （尤指對好壞、真實性的）懷疑，疑慮，疑問
eng: (a feeling of) not being certain about something, especially about how good or true it is
chisen: 如果對火箭引擎還存有任何疑慮，我們都應該取消此次發射。
engsen: If there's any doubt about the rocket's engines , we ought to cancel the launch .

chi: （尤指對好壞、真實性的）懷疑，疑慮，疑問
eng: (a feeling of) not being certain about something, especially about how good or true it is
chisen: 此次起訴必須證明他所犯的罪行證據確鑿。
engsen: The prosecution has to establish his guilt beyond reasonable doubt (US beyond a reasonable) doubt .

chi: （尤指對好壞、真實性的）懷疑，疑慮，疑問
eng: (a feeling of) not being certain about something, especially about how good or true it is
chisen: 最近這宗醜聞讓人們對他是否能夠贏得大選表示懷疑。
engsen: This latest scandal has raised doubts about whether he could win the election .

chi: （尤指對好壞、真實性的）懷疑，疑慮，疑問
eng: (a feeling of) not being certain about something, especially about how good or true it is
chisen: 我從未懷疑你會獲勝。
engsen: I never had any doubt (that) you would win .

chi: （尤指對好壞、真實性的）懷疑，疑慮，疑問
eng: (a feeling of) not being certain about something, especially about how good or true it is
chisen: 毫無疑問他是這個房間裡最有吸引力的男人。
engsen: He's the most attractive man in the room , no doubt about that/it .

chi: 炸麵包圈；炸果醬麵包；甜甜圈
eng: a small, circular cake, fried in hot fat, either with a hole in the middle or filled with jam
chisen: 炸果醬麵包
engsen: a jam (US jelly) doughnut

chi: 在市中心（的）；朝市中心（的）
eng: in or to the central part of a city
chisen: 洛杉磯市中心
engsen: downtown Los Angeles

chi: 在市中心（的）；朝市中心（的）
eng: in or to the central part of a city
chisen: 市內地址
engsen: a downtown address

chi: 在市中心（的）；朝市中心（的）
eng: in or to the central part of a city
chisen: 我在城裡上班，但住在郊區。
engsen: I work downtown , but I live in the suburbs .

eng: written abbreviation for Doctor

engsen: An appointment has been made for you to see Dr Tracey Weaver on 19 July at 2.30 p.m .

eng: to move something by pulling it along a surface, usually the ground
chisen: 把椅子拿起來，不要在地上拖！
engsen: Pick the chair up instead of dragging it behind you !

eng: to move something by pulling it along a surface, usually the ground
chisen: 她把獨木舟拉到水邊。
engsen: She dragged the canoe down to the water .

chi: （電影或表演等）枯燥；拖拖拉拉
eng: If something such as a film or performance drags, it seems to go slowly because it is boring.
chisen: 電影的上半部很有趣，但下半部卻拖拖拉拉。
engsen: The first half of the movie was interesting but the second half dragged (on) .

eng: an unfriendly and frightening woman
chisen: 她真是個老惡婆。
engsen: She's a real old dragon .

eng: a play in a theatre or on television or radio, or plays and acting generally
chisen: 她演過幾部電視劇。
engsen: She's starred in several TV dramas .

eng: a play in a theatre or on television or radio, or plays and acting generally
chisen: 他是《泰晤士報》的戲劇評論員。
engsen: He's the drama critic for the Times .

eng: a play in a theatre or on television or radio, or plays and acting generally
chisen: 她在大學裡學的是英語和戲劇。
engsen: She studied English and drama at college .

chi: （尤指突然的）戲劇性場面，戲劇性事件
eng: an event or situation, especially an unexpected one, in which there is worry or excitement and usually a lot of action
chisen: 昨晚我們有一個小插曲——鍋裡的油著火了。
engsen: We had a little drama last night when the oil in the pan caught fire .

eng: a box-shaped container, without a top, that is part of a piece of furniture. It slides in and out to open and close and is used for keeping things in.
chisen: 我把襪子放在最下麵的抽屜裡。
engsen: I keep my socks in the bottom drawer .

eng: a box-shaped container, without a top, that is part of a piece of furniture. It slides in and out to open and close and is used for keeping things in.
chisen: 他翻遍書桌抽屜，想要找到一支筆。
engsen: He rummaged through his desk drawer trying to find a pen .

eng: the act of making a picture with a pencil or pen, or a picture made in this way
chisen: 羅西喜歡畫畫。
engsen: Rosie loves drawing .

eng: the act of making a picture with a pencil or pen, or a picture made in this way
chisen: 她送了我一幅很漂亮的畫，上面畫著一匹馬。
engsen: She gave me a beautiful drawing of a horse .

eng: a piece of clothing for women or girls that covers the top half of the body and hangs down over the legs
chisen: 長／短裙
engsen: a long/short dress

eng: a piece of clothing for women or girls that covers the top half of the body and hangs down over the legs
chisen: 婚紗
engsen: a wedding dress

eng: to fall or to allow something to fall
chisen: 她把鎖匙掉了。
engsen: She dropped her keys .

eng: to fall or to allow something to fall
chisen: 我總是掉東西。
engsen: I'm always dropping things .

eng: to fall or to allow something to fall
chisen: 阿曼達把太陽鏡掉進噴水池裡了。
engsen: Amanda dropped her sunglasses in/into the fountain .

eng: to fall or to allow something to fall
chisen: 書從書架上掉了下來。
engsen: The book dropped from/off the shelf .

eng: to fall or to allow something to fall
chisen: 別讓那東西掉下來！
engsen: Don't drop it!/Don't let it drop !

eng: to move to a lower level, or cause something to move to a lower level
chisen: 受災地區的洪水終於開始退去了。
engsen: The water level in the flooded region has finally begun to drop .

eng: to move to a lower level, or cause something to move to a lower level
chisen: 在這道屏障的後面，地勢急劇傾斜而下。
engsen: The land drops (away) (= slopes down) sharply behind the barrier .

eng: to move to a lower level, or cause something to move to a lower level
chisen: 由於經濟不景氣，我們不得不降低了價格。
engsen: We had to drop our prices because of the recession .

chi: 停止，放棄（尤指某種活動）
eng: to stop doing or planning something, especially an activity
chisen: 我準備不再練瑜伽而開始做有氧運動。
engsen: I'm going to drop yoga and do aerobics instead .

chi: 停止，放棄（尤指某種活動）
eng: to stop doing or planning something, especially an activity
chisen: 你能停下手裡的工作來幫我寫這份報告嗎？
engsen: Can you drop what you're doing and help me with this report ?

chi: （通常指用汽車）帶，捎（某人至某地）
eng: to take someone to a particular place, usually in a car, and leave them there
chisen: 他們把我帶到正門。
engsen: They dropped me off at the main entrance .

chi: （通常指用汽車）帶，捎（某人至某地）
eng: to take someone to a particular place, usually in a car, and leave them there
chisen: 我開車把他帶到圖書館後就去買東西去了。
engsen: I dropped him at the library and went shopping .

eng: any natural or artificially made chemical that is used as a medicine
chisen: 處方藥
engsen: a prescription drug

eng: any natural or artificially made chemical that is used as a medicine
chisen: 為了治病他要吃好幾種藥。
engsen: He takes several drugs for his condition .

eng: any natural or artificially made chemical that is taken for pleasure, to improve someone's performance of an activity, or because a person cannot stop using it
chisen: 吸毒成癮者
engsen: a drug addict

eng: any natural or artificially made chemical that is taken for pleasure, to improve someone's performance of an activity, or because a person cannot stop using it
chisen: 她開始懷疑兒子在吸毒。
engsen: She began to suspect that her son was on/taking/doing drugs .

eng: any natural or artificially made chemical that is taken for pleasure, to improve someone's performance of an activity, or because a person cannot stop using it
chisen: 她被懷疑是毒品販子。
engsen: She was suspected of being a drug dealer .

eng: any natural or artificially made chemical that is taken for pleasure, to improve someone's performance of an activity, or because a person cannot stop using it
chisen: 他的兒子因吸毒過量而死亡。
engsen: His son died of a drug overdose .

eng: a musical instrument, especially one made from a skin stretched over the end of a hollow tube or bowl, played by hitting with the hand or a stick
chisen: 大／小／定音鼓
engsen: a bass/snare/kettle drum

eng: a musical instrument, especially one made from a skin stretched over the end of a hollow tube or bowl, played by hitting with the hand or a stick
chisen: 他們隨著鼓聲翩翩起舞。
engsen: They danced to the beat of the drums (= sound of the drums being hit) .

eng: a large tube-like container
chisen: 油桶
engsen: an oil drum

eng: a large tube-like container
chisen: 五加侖的塑膠桶
engsen: a five-gallon plastic drum

eng: a large tube-like container
chisen: 一桶放射性廢料
engsen: a drum of radioactive waste

eng: a machine that dries things

engsen: a hair dryer

eng: a machine that dries things
chisen: 糧食烘乾機
engsen: a grain dryer

eng: a machine that dries things
chisen: 把那些濕衣服放到（滾筒式）烘乾機裡去。
engsen: Put those damp clothes in the (tumble) dryer .

eng: not interesting or exciting in any way
chisen: 她爲當地報紙寫一些乏味的官樣文章。
engsen: She wrote dull , respectable articles for the local newspaper .

eng: not interesting or exciting in any way
chisen: 他很和善，但太乏味。
engsen: He's pleasant enough , but deadly dull .

eng: not clear, bright, or shiny
chisen: 我們只能看見爐火的餘燼發出的微弱的光。
engsen: We could just see a dull glow given off by the fire's last embers .

eng: not clear, bright, or shiny
chisen: 我們渡假的第一天天空陰雲密佈。
engsen: The first day of our holiday was dull (= cloudy) .

eng: A dull sound or pain is not sharp or clear.
chisen: 聽見廚房裡傳來砰的一聲悶響，我意識到一定是她暈倒了。
engsen: I heard a dull thud from the kitchen and realized she must have fainted .

eng: A dull sound or pain is not sharp or clear.
chisen: 來往車輛的低沈轟鳴聲把她吵醒了。
engsen: The dull rumble of traffic woke her .

eng: A dull sound or pain is not sharp or clear.
chisen: 她感到後腦勺隱隱作痛。
engsen: She felt a dull ache at the back of her head .

eng: permanently or temporarily unable to speak
chisen: 他生下來就又聾又啞。
engsen: He's been deaf and dumb since birth .

eng: permanently or temporarily unable to speak
chisen: 她被自己看到的嚇得說不出話來。
engsen: She was struck dumb by what she had seen .

eng: stupid
chisen: 他們勇敢還是愚蠢而已？
engsen: Are they brave or just dumb ?

eng: stupid
chisen: 這想法太蠢了！
engsen: What a dumb idea !

eng: something that you have to do because it is part of your job, or something that you feel is the right thing to do
chisen: 這個機構的責任就是爲孩子謀取最大利益。
engsen: The duty of the agency is to act in the best interests of the child .

eng: something that you have to do because it is part of your job, or something that you feel is the right thing to do
chisen: 我覺得我有責任告訴他們真相。
engsen: I felt it was my duty to tell them the truth .

eng: something that you have to do because it is part of your job, or something that you feel is the right thing to do
chisen: 偶爾你該給自己放個假。
engsen: You have a duty to yourself to take a break once in a while .

eng: something that you have to do because it is part of your job, or something that you feel is the right thing to do
chisen: 他去看她只是出於義務。
engsen: He only went to see her out of duty (= because he thought he should) .

eng: something that you have to do because it is part of your job, or something that you feel is the right thing to do
chisen: 你應該在週一上午八點報到。
engsen: You should report for duty (= arrive at work) at 8 a.m . on Monday .

eng: something that you have to do because it is part of your job, or something that you feel is the right thing to do
chisen: 明天你幾點下／上班？
engsen: What time are you off/on duty (= when do you finish/start work) tomorrow ?

eng: a tax paid to the government, especially on things that you bring into a country
chisen: 酒類的關稅很高。
engsen: There's a high duty on alcohol .

eng: to receive money as payment for work that you do
chisen: 我一年賺八萬美元。
engsen: I earn $80,000 a year .

eng: to receive money as payment for work that you do
chisen: 如果你不介意的話，能告訴我你賺多少錢嗎？
engsen: How much do you earn , if you don't mind me asking ?

eng: to receive money as payment for work that you do
chisen: 你不能指望靠畫畫來維持生計。
engsen: You can't expect to earn a living (= be paid enough money to live on) from your painting .

eng: to receive money as payment for work that you do

engsen: Coffee exports earn (= give) Brazil many millions of dollars a year./Brazil earns many millions of dollars a year from coffee exports .

eng: a sudden violent movement of the earth's surface, sometimes causing great damage
chisen: 1906年的大地震給舊金山大部分市區帶來毀滅性的災難。
engsen: In 1906 an earthquake destroyed much of San Francisco .

chi: （某個地區的）東部的；來自東部的
eng: in or from the east part of an area
chisen: 這個國家的東部地區多山。
engsen: The eastern part of the country is very mountainous .

chi: （某個地區的）東部的；來自東部的
eng: in or from the east part of an area
chisen: 直到1991年左右，東方集團是指蘇聯和東歐的共産主義國家。
engsen: Until about 1991 , the Eastern bloc was the Soviet Union and the communist countries of eastern Europe .

chi: （某個地區的）東部的；來自東部的
eng: in or from the east part of an area
chisen: 佛教和其他東方宗教讓我著迷。
engsen: Buddhism and other Eastern (= Asian) religions fascinate me .

chi: 教育；受教育獲得的知識
eng: the process of teaching or learning, especially in a school or college, or the knowledge that you get from this
chisen: 童年時他主要在家中接受教育。
engsen: As a child he received most of his education at home .

chi: 教育；受教育獲得的知識
eng: the process of teaching or learning, especially in a school or college, or the knowledge that you get from this
chisen: 這是個非常重視教育的國家。
engsen: It's a country that places great importance on education .

chi: 教育；受教育獲得的知識
eng: the process of teaching or learning, especially in a school or college, or the knowledge that you get from this
chisen: 她在教師培訓學院講授教育學。
engsen: She lectures in education (= the study of education) at the teacher training college .

chi: 教育；受教育獲得的知識
eng: the process of teaching or learning, especially in a school or college, or the knowledge that you get from this
chisen: 孩子得到良好的教育是非常重要的。
engsen: It's important for children to get a good education .

eng: the result of a particular influence
chisen: 核輻射外泄給環境帶來了災難性的影響。
engsen: The radiation leak has had a disastrous effect on/upon the environment .

eng: the result of a particular influence
chisen: 我試著吃了幾顆藥片，但頭痛一點都沒有減輕。
engsen: I tried taking tablets for the headache but they didn't have any effect .

eng: the result of a particular influence
chisen: 我覺得我睡眠太少，健康受到了影響。
engsen: I think I'm suffering from the effects of too little sleep .

eng: the result of a particular influence
chisen: 她很自信，在面試時她充分利用這一點，佔盡了優勢。
engsen: She has a lot of confidence , which she uses to good effect (= to her advantage) in interviews .

eng: use
chisen: 在租期結束前，將會繼續採用現行的付款方式。
engsen: The present system of payment will remain in effect (= be used) until the end of the rental agreement .

eng: use
chisen: 新的道路交通安全法規甚麽時候開始實施？
engsen: When do the new driving laws come into effect ?

eng: use
chisen: 新的加薪標準將從一月份起正式實行。
engsen: The new salary increases will take effect (= begin) from January onwards .

eng: lighting, sounds, and objects that are specially produced for the stage or a film and are intended to make something that does not exist seem real
chisen: 這部電影光憑其特技效果就值得一看。
engsen: This is a movie worth seeing for its effects alone .

chi: （尤指死後遺留的）財産，財物，所有物
eng: a person's possessions, especially after their death
chisen: 表上寫明，所有個人財產都在該保險承保範圍之內。
engsen: It says on the form that the insurance covers all personal effects .

chi: 能産生預期結果的；有效的
eng: successful or achieving the results that you want
chisen: 這種藥物治療頭痛極其有效。
engsen: It's an extremely effective cure for a headache .

chi: 能産生預期結果的；有效的
eng: successful or achieving the results that you want
chisen: 該戲劇的舞臺燈光設計巧妙地運用了陰影效果。
engsen: The lighting for the production made a very effective use of shadow .

chi: 能産生預期結果的；有效的
eng: successful or achieving the results that you want
chisen: 她課教得非常好。
engsen: She's a very effective teacher .

eng: in fact, although not officially
chisen: 她雖然名義上不是我們的老闆，但實際上掌管著該辦事處。
engsen: Although she's not officially our boss , she's in effective control of the office .

eng: If a law or rule becomes effective, it starts to be used.
chisen: 新法律將在下月正式生效。
engsen: The new laws will become effective next month .

eng: physical or mental activity needed to achieve something
chisen: 如果我們都努力保持整潔，那麽辦公室的面貌肯定會大有改觀。
engsen: If we could all make an effort to keep this office tidier it would help .

eng: physical or mental activity needed to achieve something
chisen: 如果不努力去和人們交往，你就別想有朋友。
engsen: You can't expect to have any friends if you don't make the effort with people .

eng: physical or mental activity needed to achieve something
chisen: 爲了減少犯罪，政府擴充了警力。
engsen: In their efforts to reduce crime the government expanded the police force .

eng: physical or mental activity needed to achieve something
chisen: 爲了調整好身體狀況，他現在每天早晨都繞著公園慢跑。
engsen: He's jogging around the park every morning in an effort to get fit .

eng: physical or mental activity needed to achieve something
chisen: 做這道菜很費時間，但結果大家都很愛吃，工夫真沒白費。
engsen: It takes a long time to prepare the dish but the results are so good that it's worth the effort .

chi: （尤指在社會上地位高、受人尊敬的）長者，長輩，老年人
eng: an older person, especially one with a respected position in society
chisen: 你應該聽長輩的建議。
engsen: You should listen to the advice of your elders .

chi: （尤指在社會上地位高、受人尊敬的）長者，長輩，老年人
eng: an older person, especially one with a respected position in society
chisen: 他們向村裡的長輩們諮詢了意見。
engsen: They consulted the village elders .

chi: （尤指在社會上地位高、受人尊敬的）長者，長輩，老年人
eng: an older person, especially one with a respected position in society
chisen: 她比我年長三歲。
engsen: She is my elder by three years (= three years older than I am) .

eng: to decide on or choose, especially to choose a person for a particular job, by voting
chisen: 總統任期四年。
engsen: The President is elected for a four-year term of office .

eng: to decide on or choose, especially to choose a person for a particular job, by voting
chisen: 我們選他當代表。
engsen: We elected him as our representative .

eng: to decide on or choose, especially to choose a person for a particular job, by voting
chisen: 她被選爲董事會主席。
engsen: She was elected Chair of the Board of Governors .

eng: to decide on or choose, especially to choose a person for a particular job, by voting
chisen: 該團體選出了他們的一名成員代表他們發言。
engsen: The group elected one of their members to be their spokesperson .

eng: a part of something
chisen: 列舉出盡善盡美的晚宴所有的構成要素。
engsen: List the elements that make up a perfect dinner party .

eng: a part of something
chisen: 這部電影具備了一部精彩的驚慄片的一切要素。
engsen: The movie had all the elements of a good thriller .

eng: a part of something
chisen: 學校連基本的物理知識都沒有教給我們。
engsen: We weren't even taught the elements of (= basic information about) physics at school .

eng: a small amount of an emotion or quality
chisen: 她說的話當然也有些是真的。
engsen: There was certainly an element of truth in what she said .

eng: a small amount of an emotion or quality
chisen: 你不覺得所有這一切都是妒嫉在隱隱作祟?
engsen: Don't you think there's an element of jealousy in all of this ?

eng: a small amount of an emotion or quality
chisen: 我們輕手輕腳地走近門口，想製造一個驚喜。
engsen: We walked quietly up to the door to preserve the element of surprise .

chi: 不斷想（某事）；仍然記得（某事）
eng: to continue to think about or remember something
chisen: 我和那個女人的命運已經交織在一起了，這個想法在我腦海揮之不去。
engsen: It is somehow fixed in my mind that my fate and that woman's are intertwined .

chi: 不斷想（某事）；仍然記得（某事）
eng: to continue to think about or remember something
chisen: 她害怕得腦海一片混亂，根本甚麼也想不清楚。
engsen: She was so frightened that she could not fix her thoughts on anything .

chi: 操縱；在（比賽或選舉）中作弊
eng: to do something dishonest to make certain that a competition, race, or election is won by a particular person
chisen: 幾名騎師因涉嫌在比賽中作弊而被捕。
engsen: Several jockeys were arrested on suspicion of fixing the race .

chi: 操縱；在（比賽或選舉）中作弊
eng: to do something dishonest to make certain that a competition, race, or election is won by a particular person
chisen: 聽起來好像有人操縱這次選舉。
engsen: It sounds like the election was fixed .

chi: 梳洗，整理（頭髮、容妝、衣服等）
eng: to make your hair, make-up, clothes, etc. look tidy
chisen: 給我幾分鐘時間整理一下頭髮。
engsen: Give me a couple of minutes while I fix my hair .

eng: to cook or prepare food or drink
chisen: 輪到誰做晚飯了？
engsen: Whose turn is it to fix dinner ?

eng: to cook or prepare food or drink
chisen: 我給你倒杯飲料好嗎？
engsen: Can I fix you a drink?/Can I fix a drink for you ?

chi: 懲罰，收拾（尤指待人不公者）
eng: to punish especially someone who has been unfair
chisen: 如果她還在不停地造我的謠，我就打算收拾她了！
engsen: I'm gonna fix her if she doesn't stop telling lies about me !

eng: to inject (= put into the body through a needle) an illegal drug
chisen: 我們看見門口那些年僅12歲的孩子在注射毒品。
engsen: We saw kids as young as twelve fixing in doorways .

eng: a piece of cloth, usually rectangular and attached to a pole at one edge, that has a pattern that shows it represents a country or a group, or has a particular meaning
chisen: 所有參賽國家的國旗都飄揚在體育場外。
engsen: Flags of all the participating countries are flying outside the stadium .

eng: a piece of cloth, usually rectangular and attached to a pole at one edge, that has a pattern that shows it represents a country or a group, or has a particular meaning
chisen: 旗子在和風中飄揚。
engsen: Flags were flapping/fluttering in the breeze .

eng: a piece of cloth, usually rectangular and attached to a pole at one edge, that has a pattern that shows it represents a country or a group, or has a particular meaning
chisen: 護衛揮旗示意，火車從車站駛離。
engsen: The guard waved his flag and the train pulled away from the station .

eng: to shine brightly and suddenly, or to make something shine in this way
chisen: 別拿那個手電筒晃我的眼睛了！
engsen: Stop flashing that light in my eyes !

eng: to shine brightly and suddenly, or to make something shine in this way
chisen: 電光閃過，遠處雷聲隆隆。
engsen: The lightning flashed and distant thunder rolled .

eng: to shine brightly and suddenly, or to make something shine in this way
chisen: 你最好減速，那輛車正朝你閃車燈呢。
engsen: You'd better slow down , that car was flashing its lights at you .

eng: to move very fast
chisen: 他們騎著機車飛馳而過。
engsen: They flashed past/by on a motorcycle .

eng: to show something for a short time
chisen: 他笑了一下，提出請我喝一杯。
engsen: He flashed a smile and offered to buy me a drink .

chi: （尤指用無線電或光波）通信，聯絡
eng: to communicate something quickly, especially using radio or light waves
chisen: 事件發生之後不久，消息就能迅速傳遍世界。
engsen: Within moments of an event happening , the news can be flashed around the world .

eng: If something flashes through/across your mind, you suddenly or quickly think of it.
chisen: 我突然想到，她不想來這裡。
engsen: The thought suddenly flashed through my mind that she didn't want to be here .

eng: a small light that is held in the hand and usually gets its power from batteries
chisen: 她用手電筒照了照黑暗的房間。
engsen: She shone the flashlight into the dark room .

eng: level and smooth, with no curved, high, or hollow parts
chisen: 溜冰場地必須十分平坦。
engsen: An ice rink needs to be completely flat .

eng: level and smooth, with no curved, high, or hollow parts
chisen: 在平的面板上把油酥麵團擀薄。
engsen: Roll out the pastry on a flat surface .

eng: level and smooth, with no curved, high, or hollow parts
chisen: 那一地區的許多鄉村都地勢平坦。
engsen: Much of the countryside in that region is very flat .

eng: level but having little or no height
chisen: 平底鞋
engsen: flat shoes (= ones without a raised heel)

chi: 不積極的；不感興趣的；缺乏熱情的
eng: not interesting, or without emotion or excitement
chisen: 派對的興奮感過去之後，生活現在似乎相當乏味。
engsen: After the excitement of the party , life seems somewhat flat now .

chi: 不積極的；不感興趣的；缺乏熱情的
eng: not interesting, or without emotion or excitement
chisen: 我覺得她的表演有點平淡。
engsen: I thought her performance a little flat .

chi: 不積極的；不感興趣的；缺乏熱情的
eng: not interesting, or without emotion or excitement
chisen: 我認為這幅油畫的色彩有些平淡。
engsen: I think the colours in this painting are kind of flat (= not varied or bright) .

eng: with no electrical power left in it
chisen: 我的車燈沒關，現在電池沒電了。
engsen: I left my car lights on and now the battery is flat .

eng: If a drink is flat, it has stopped being fizzy (= with bubbles).
chisen: 你要是不把那瓶啤酒的瓶蓋蓋上，它會走氣的。
engsen: If you don't put the top back on that bottle of beer , it will go flat .

eng: complete or certain, and not likely to change
chisen: 他的休假要求遭到了斷然拒絕。
engsen: His request for time off work was met with a flat refusal .

eng: complete or certain, and not likely to change
chisen: 那位官員矢口否認對她的那些指控。
engsen: The official has issued a flat denial of the accusations against her .

chi: （輪胎或球）洩了氣的，撒了氣的
eng: If something such as a tyre or ball is flat, it does not contain enough air.
chisen: 我的車胎紮了釘子後洩了氣了。
engsen: I got a flat tyre (= the air went out of it) after driving over a nail .

eng: (especially of an amount of money) fixed and not likely to change
chisen: 我們每小時統一收費25美元。
engsen: We charge a flat fee/rate of $25 per hour .

eng: If profits, sales, etc. are flat, they are not growing or increasing.
chisen: 在海外對我們生產的機器需求在不斷增長，在國內卻十分平緩。
engsen: Demand for our machinery abroad is increasing , while growth is flat at home .

eng: a journey in an aircraft
chisen: 我永遠也不會忘記第一次乘飛機的經歷。
engsen: I'll never forget my first flight .

eng: a journey in an aircraft
chisen: 空中旅行感覺如何？
engsen: How was your flight ?

eng: a journey in an aircraft
chisen: 因天氣不好，今天飛往紐約的所有航班都延誤了。
engsen: All flights to New York today are delayed because of bad weather .

eng: a journey in an aircraft
chisen: 我的航班取消了。
engsen: My flight was cancelled .

eng: an aircraft that is making a particular journey
chisen: 飛往布宜諾斯艾利斯的474航班現在正在九號閘口登機。
engsen: Flight 474 to Buenos Aires is now boarding at Gate 9 .

eng: an occasion when something flies or moves through the air
chisen: 飛翔的鷹
engsen: an eagle in flight

eng: an occasion when something flies or moves through the air
chisen: 突然，整群大雁都飛了起來。
engsen: Suddenly the whole flock of geese took flight (= started flying) .

eng: an occasion when something flies or moves through the air
chisen: 現代導彈十分精確，因為其飛行路線是由電腦控制的。
engsen: Modern missiles are so accurate because their flight is controlled by computer .

eng: (an act or example of) escape, running away, or avoiding something
chisen: 在躲避侵略軍時，他們失去了所有的財産。
engsen: They lost all their possessions during their flight from the invading army .

chi: （通常指兩個樓層間的）一段樓梯，一段臺階
eng: a set of steps or stairs, usually between two floors of a building
chisen: 我們住在三樓。
engsen: We live up three flights of stairs .

eng: to cause to fill or become covered with water, especially in a way that causes problems
chisen: 我們的洗衣機昨天壞了，把廚房裡弄得到處是水。
engsen: Our washing machine broke down yesterday and flooded the kitchen .

eng: to cause to fill or become covered with water, especially in a way that causes problems
chisen: 河水決堤，整個鎮子都淹了。
engsen: The whole town flooded when the river burst its banks .

eng: to cause to fill or become covered with water, especially in a way that causes problems
chisen: 住在河邊的幾戶人家因洪水被迫撤離。
engsen: Several families living by the river were flooded out (= forced to leave their houses because they became covered with water) .

chi: 大量湧入；蜂擁而至；擠滿；充斥
eng: to fill or enter a place in large numbers or amounts
chisen: 收容所收到大量捐贈。
engsen: Donations are flooding into the homeless shelter .

chi: 大量湧入；蜂擁而至；擠滿；充斥
eng: to fill or enter a place in large numbers or amounts
chisen: 她拉開窗簾，陽光傾瀉進來。
engsen: She drew back the curtains and the sunlight came flooding in .

chi: 大量湧入；蜂擁而至；擠滿；充斥
eng: to fill or enter a place in large numbers or amounts
chisen: 日本汽車已經充斥了市場。
engsen: Japanese cars have flooded the market (= a lot of them are on sale) .

chi: 大量湧入；蜂擁而至；擠滿；充斥
eng: to fill or enter a place in large numbers or amounts
chisen: 第一個孩子出生時，他滿心歡喜。
engsen: He was flooded with (= suddenly felt a lot of) joy when his first child was born .

chi: 大量湧入；蜂擁而至；擠滿；充斥
eng: to fill or enter a place in large numbers or amounts
chisen: 對於普魯斯特來說，瑪德琳蛋糕的味道讓他回憶起許多童年往事。
engsen: For Proust , the taste of a madeleine brought childhood memories flooding back (= made him suddenly remember a lot of things) .

eng: (especially of liquids, gases, or electricity) to move in one direction, especially continuously and easily
chisen: 火山岩漿順著山坡往下流。
engsen: Lava from the volcano was flowing down the hillside .

eng: (especially of liquids, gases, or electricity) to move in one direction, especially continuously and easily
chisen: 許多小河匯入太平洋。
engsen: Many short rivers flow into the Pacific Ocean .

eng: (especially of liquids, gases, or electricity) to move in one direction, especially continuously and easily
chisen: 這條河流在匯入此處正南邊的大海之前流經了三個郡縣。
engsen: The river flows through three counties before flowing into the sea just south of here .

eng: (especially of liquids, gases, or electricity) to move in one direction, especially continuously and easily
chisen: 路上的車少了，交通比平時更通暢了。
engsen: With fewer cars on the roads , traffic is flowing (= moving forward) more smoothly than usual .

chi: 持續抵達；持續供應（或生産）
eng: to continue to arrive or be produced
chisen: 請繼續投錢進來！
engsen: Please keep the money flowing in !

chi: 持續抵達；持續供應（或生産）
eng: to continue to arrive or be produced
chisen: 援助源源不斷地從全國各地到達災區。
engsen: Offers of help are flowing into the disaster area from all over the country .

chi: 持續抵達；持續供應（或生産）
eng: to continue to arrive or be produced
chisen: 如果在電腦上工作，我的想法會更流暢一些。
engsen: My thoughts flow more easily if I work on a computer .

chi: 持續抵達；持續供應（或生産）
eng: to continue to arrive or be produced
chisen: 到11點時，開始大量提供葡萄酒。
engsen: By eleven o'clock , the wine was starting to flow .

chi: 持續抵達；持續供應（或生産）
eng: to continue to arrive or be produced
chisen: 他們都喝了一兩杯之後，談話開始無拘無束起來。
engsen: After they'd all had a drink or two , the conversation began to flow .

eng: to hang down loosely and often attractively
chisen: 她紅色的長髮飄垂在肩頭。
engsen: Her long red hair flowed down over her shoulders .

eng: a common infectious illness that causes fever and headache
chisen: 流感病毒
engsen: a flu virus

eng: a common infectious illness that causes fever and headache
chisen: 患／染／得流感
engsen: to catch/get/have (the) flu

chi: （尤指注意力或興趣的）中心，焦點
eng: the main or central point of something, especially of attention or interest
chisen: 我覺得戴夫喜歡受人關注。
engsen: I think Dave likes to be the focus of attention .

chi: （尤指注意力或興趣的）中心，焦點
eng: the main or central point of something, especially of attention or interest
chisen: 時裝表演上人們興趣的主要焦點是克裡斯琴‧拉克魯瓦那身奇特的晚裝。
engsen: The main focus of interest at the fashion show was Christian Lacroix's outrageous evening wear .

chi: （尤指注意力或興趣的）中心，焦點
eng: the main or central point of something, especially of attention or interest
chisen: 媒體關注政客們的私生活，這必然將人們的注意力從實際問題上轉移開來。
engsen: The media focus on politicians' private lives inevitably switches the attention away from the real issues .

chi: （物理學中光波、聲波等的）焦點，聚光點
eng: (in physics) the point where waves of light or sound that are moving towards each other meet
chisen: 透鏡的焦點
engsen: the focus of a lens

eng: with fog
chisen: 寒冷起霧的一天
engsen: a cold , foggy day

eng: after
chisen: 暴亂之後的幾周氣氛極其緊張。
engsen: The weeks following the riots were extremely tense .

eng: after
chisen: 晚餐之後將有一場舞會。
engsen: Following the dinner , there will be a dance .

eng: a person who behaves in a silly way without thinking
chisen: 你這個傻瓜，你錯過機會了！
engsen: You fool , you missed your chance !

eng: a person who behaves in a silly way without thinking
chisen: 如果他以為她還愛著自己，那他就是個傻瓜。
engsen: He's a fool if he thinks she still loves him .

eng: a person who behaves in a silly way without thinking
chisen: 他說會還我錢，我象一個傻瓜一樣相信了他。
engsen: He said he would pay me back and like a fool , I believed him .

eng: a person who behaves in a silly way without thinking
chisen: 他以為她還愛著自己，真是個傻瓜。
engsen: He's a fool to think she still loves him .

eng: unwise, stupid, or not showing good judgment
chisen: 做那樣的事可真是蠢。
engsen: That was a rather foolish thing to do .

eng: unwise, stupid, or not showing good judgment
chisen: 她怕如果拒絕會使自己看起來像個傻瓜。
engsen: She was afraid that she would look foolish if she refused .

eng: unwise, stupid, or not showing good judgment
chisen: 他們花了這麽多錢，真傻。
engsen: It was foolish of them to pay so much .

eng: a game played between two teams of eleven people, where each team tries to win by kicking a ball into the other team's goal
chisen: 足球運動員／足球隊
engsen: a football player/team

eng: a game played between two teams of eleven people, where each team tries to win by kicking a ball into the other team's goal
chisen: 他在踢足球。
engsen: He's playing football .

eng: a game played between two teams of eleven people, where each team tries to win by kicking a ball into the other team's goal
chisen: 你來看足球比賽嗎？
engsen: Are you coming to the football match ?

eng: a game played between two teams of eleven people, where each team tries to win by kicking a ball into the other team's goal
chisen: 我算不上一個狂熱的足球迷。
engsen: I'm not a big football fan .

eng: to stop blaming or being angry with someone for something that person has done, or not punish them for something
chisen: 我覺得不念舊惡殊為不易。
engsen: I've never found it easy to forgive and forget (= to behave as if something wrong had never happened) .

eng: to stop blaming or being angry with someone for something that person has done, or not punish them for something
chisen: 要是孩子們有個三長兩短，我永遠也不會原諒自己。
engsen: I'd never forgive myself if anything happened to the kids .

eng: to say that money does not have to be paid back
chisen: 在一個新的項目中，前往內布拉斯加教書的大學畢業生可免還政府貸款。
engsen: The new program would forgive state loans to new graduates who teach in Nebraska .

eng: to begin to exist or to make something begin to exist
chisen: 事故現場圍起了一群人。
engsen: A crowd formed around the accident .

eng: to begin to exist or to make something begin to exist
chisen: 她想到了一個解決辦法。
engsen: A solution began to form in her mind .

eng: to begin to exist or to make something begin to exist
chisen: 我形成了一種印象：她其實並不想來。
engsen: I formed the impression (= the way she behaved suggested to me) that she didn't really want to come .

eng: public or official
chisen: 正式聲明
engsen: a formal announcement

chi: （語言、服裝和行為）莊重的，正規的，適合正式場合的
eng: Formal language, clothes, and behaviour are suitable for serious or official occasions.
chisen: 正式宴會
engsen: a formal dinner party

eng: Formal education or training is received in a school or college.
chisen: 湯姆沒怎麽受過正規教育。
engsen: Tom had little formal education .

chi: 較早的，早先的；以前的；舊時的
eng: of or in an earlier time; before the present time or in the past
chisen: 他的前妻
engsen: his former wife

chi: 較早的，早先的；以前的；舊時的
eng: of or in an earlier time; before the present time or in the past
chisen: 前僱主
engsen: a former employer

chi: 較早的，早先的；以前的；舊時的
eng: of or in an earlier time; before the present time or in the past
chisen: 美國前總統
engsen: the former president of the United States

chi: 較早的，早先的；以前的；舊時的
eng: of or in an earlier time; before the present time or in the past
chisen: 這些豪華公寓的前身是工廠廠房。
engsen: The luxury apartments are in a former factory .

chi: 較早的，早先的；以前的；舊時的
eng: of or in an earlier time; before the present time or in the past
chisen: 這幅油畫又恢復了原先的光彩。
engsen: The painting was then restored to its former glory (= returned to its original good condition) .

chi: 較早的，早先的；以前的；舊時的
eng: of or in an earlier time; before the present time or in the past
chisen: 事故過後很長時間，他似乎才恢復了先前的樣子。
engsen: It was a long time after the accident before he seemed like his former self (= behaved in the way he had before) .

eng: towards the direction that is in front of you
chisen: 她傾身向前，對我耳語了一番。
engsen: She leaned forward to whisper something in my ear .

eng: towards the future
chisen: 我總是放眼未來，而不是回首過去。
engsen: I always look forward , not back .

eng: used in expressions related to progress
chisen: 這是向民主邁進的一大步。
engsen: This is a big step forward for democracy .

eng: someone who is clever and good at deceiving people
chisen: 他是一個狡猾／陰險／詭計多端的老狐狸。
engsen: He's a cunning/sly/wily old fox .

chi: 坦率的，坦誠的；直言不諱的
eng: honest, sincere, and telling the truth, even when this might be awkward or make other people uncomfortable
chisen: 全面而坦誠的討論
engsen: a full and frank discussion

chi: 坦率的，坦誠的；直言不諱的
eng: honest, sincere, and telling the truth, even when this might be awkward or make other people uncomfortable
chisen: 接下來大家坦誠地交換了意見。
engsen: There followed a frank exchange of views .

chi: 坦率的，坦誠的；直言不諱的
eng: honest, sincere, and telling the truth, even when this might be awkward or make other people uncomfortable
chisen: 這本雜誌面向青少年市場，對性和戀愛問題作出坦率的忠告。
engsen: The magazine , which gives frank advice about sex and romance , is aimed at the teenage market .

chi: 坦率的，坦誠的；直言不諱的
eng: honest, sincere, and telling the truth, even when this might be awkward or make other people uncomfortable
chisen: 十分坦誠地告訴你，我認為她不適合做那份工作。
engsen: To be perfectly frank with you , I don't think she's the person for the job .

eng: the condition or right of being able or allowed to do, say, think, etc. whatever you want to, without being controlled or limited
chisen: 獨自一人呆在山上，我感到非常自在。
engsen: I felt such a sense of freedom , up in the hills alone .

eng: the condition or right of being able or allowed to do, say, think, etc. whatever you want to, without being controlled or limited
chisen: 現在孩子們的自由大得多了。
engsen: Children are allowed much more freedom these days .

eng: the condition or right of being able or allowed to do, say, think, etc. whatever you want to, without being controlled or limited
chisen: 在大學裡，你想做甚麽就可以做甚麽。
engsen: In college , you have the freedom to do what you want .

eng: the condition or right of being able or allowed to do, say, think, etc. whatever you want to, without being controlled or limited
chisen: 每個人都應享有自由選擇的權利。
engsen: Everyone should be allowed freedom of choice (= the ability to make their own choices) .

eng: the condition or right of being able or allowed to do, say, think, etc. whatever you want to, without being controlled or limited
chisen: 在獨裁統治下，言論和思想的自由都被剝奪了。
engsen: Freedom of speech and freedom of thought (= the ability to say and think whatever you want) were both denied under the dictatorship .

eng: the condition or right of being able or allowed to do, say, think, etc. whatever you want to, without being controlled or limited
chisen: 他們正在爭取資訊自由。
engsen: They are campaigning for freedom of information (= for any information to be allowed to be given to anyone who wants it) .

eng: the condition or right of being able or allowed to do, say, think, etc. whatever you want to, without being controlled or limited
