chisen: 老師向每一個小朋友親切地打招呼說「你好！」
engsen: The teacher greeted each child with a friendly "Hello!"

chi: 問候；迎接；向…打招呼；對…作出反應
eng: to welcome someone with particular words or a particular action, or to react to something in the stated way
chisen: 工會聽到這個決定非常高興／憤怒。
engsen: The unions have greeted the decision with delight/anger .

eng: The growth of a person, animal, or plant is its process of increasing in size.
chisen: 營養均衡的飲食對於健康發育是不可或缺的。
engsen: A balanced diet is essential for healthy growth .

eng: The growth of a person, animal, or plant is its process of increasing in size.
chisen: 在春天和初夏之時， 植物的生長最為明顯。
engsen: Plant growth is most noticeable in spring and early summer .

eng: a person or group of people whose job is to protect a person, place, or thing from danger or attack, or to prevent a person such as a criminal from escaping
chisen: 每個入口處都設了衛兵。
engsen: There are guards posted (= standing and watching) at every entrance .

eng: a person or group of people whose job is to protect a person, place, or thing from danger or attack, or to prevent a person such as a criminal from escaping
chisen: 現場周圍設了武裝警衛。
engsen: Armed guards are posted around the site .

eng: a person or group of people whose job is to protect a person, place, or thing from danger or attack, or to prevent a person such as a criminal from escaping
chisen: 邊境警衛隊沿國境巡邏。
engsen: The frontier is patrolled by border guards .

chi: 保護裝置；保護用品；保護器
eng: a device that protects a dangerous part of something or that protects something from getting damaged
chisen: 火災防護裝置
engsen: a fire guard

chi: 保護裝置；保護用品；保護器
eng: a device that protects a dangerous part of something or that protects something from getting damaged
chisen: （鎖定）槍（扳機）的保險
engsen: a trigger guard

chi: 保護裝置；保護用品；保護器
eng: a device that protects a dangerous part of something or that protects something from getting damaged
chisen: 這個頭盔帶有一個防護面罩。
engsen: The helmet has a face guard attached .

eng: a musical instrument, usually made of wood, with six strings and a long neck, played with the fingers or a plectrum
chisen: 他坐在草地上彈著吉他。
engsen: He sat on the grass , strumming his guitar .

eng: a musical instrument, usually made of wood, with six strings and a long neck, played with the fingers or a plectrum
chisen: 原聲吉他
engsen: an acoustic guitar

eng: a musical instrument, usually made of wood, with six strings and a long neck, played with the fingers or a plectrum
chisen: 電子吉他
engsen: an electric guitar

eng: a man
chisen: 他真是個好人。
engsen: He's a really nice guy .

eng: a man
chisen: 你說的是那個滿頭金髮戴眼鏡的男人嗎?
engsen: Do you mean the guy with the blonde hair and glasses ?

eng: something that you do often and regularly, sometimes without knowing that you are doing it
chisen: 我出於習慣總是買同一個牌子的牙膏。
engsen: I always buy the same brand of toothpaste out of (= because of) habit .

eng: something that you do often and regularly, sometimes without knowing that you are doing it
chisen: 我盡量避免養成喝咖啡時總是吃餅乾的習慣。
engsen: I'm trying not to get into (= start) the habit of always having biscuits with my coffee .

eng: something that you do often and regularly, sometimes without knowing that you are doing it
chisen: 我過去每週遊兩次泳，但最近似乎打破了這個習慣。
engsen: I used to swim twice a week , but I seem to have got out of (= ended) the habit recently .

eng: something that you do often and regularly, sometimes without knowing that you are doing it
chisen: 我是跟我男友學的開車，恐怕我已經染上了他的一些壞習慣。
engsen: I was taught to drive by my boyfriend and I'm afraid I've picked up (= caught) some of his bad habits .

eng: something that you do often and regularly, sometimes without knowing that you are doing it
chisen: 我設法讓他改掉晚上一回家就打開電視的習慣。
engsen: I'm trying to get him to break (= end intentionally) the habit of switching on the TV when he comes home at night .

eng: something that you do often and regularly, sometimes without knowing that you are doing it
chisen: 我不介意半夜裡被室友吵醒一兩次，只要她不經常這樣就行。
engsen: I don't mind being woken up once or twice in the middle of the night by my flatmate so long as she doesn't make a habit of it (= do it frequently) .

eng: something that you do often and regularly, sometimes without knowing that you are doing it
chisen: 我沒有觀察別人穿著的習慣，可是就連我都注意到了那身難看的套裝！
engsen: I'm not really in the habit of looking at (= I don't usually look at) other people's clothes , but even I noticed that awful suit !

eng: the room just inside the main entrance of a house, apartment, or other building that leads to other rooms and usually to the stairs
chisen: 我把袋子掉在大廳裡了。
engsen: I left my bags in the hall .

eng: a building or large room used for events involving a lot of people
chisen: 皇家亞伯特廳
engsen: the Royal Albert Hall

eng: a building or large room used for events involving a lot of people
chisen: 音樂廳
engsen: a concert hall

eng: a building or large room used for events involving a lot of people
chisen: 學校體育館
engsen: the school sports hall

eng: a building or large room used for events involving a lot of people
chisen: 我將在村裡的禮堂／教堂大廳所舉行的音樂會參與演奏。
engsen: I'm playing in a concert at the village/church hall .

chi: 漢堡包；（漢堡式的）夾心餅
eng: meat or other food pressed into a round, flat shape and fried
chisen: 一份漢堡包和薯條
engsen: a burger and fries

chi: 漢堡包；（漢堡式的）夾心餅
eng: meat or other food pressed into a round, flat shape and fried
chisen: 蔬菜夾心餅
engsen: a veggie burger

eng: a square piece of cloth or paper used for cleaning the nose or drying the eyes when they are wet with tears
chisen: 她掏出手帕大聲地擤鼻涕。
engsen: She took out her handkerchief and blew her nose loudly .

eng: a part of an object designed for holding, moving, or carrying the object easily
chisen: 門把手
engsen: a door handle

eng: a part of an object designed for holding, moving, or carrying the object easily
chisen: 手提箱的提手
engsen: the handle on a suitcase

eng: a part of an object designed for holding, moving, or carrying the object easily
chisen: 她轉動把手，慢慢地打開門。
engsen: She turned the handle and slowly opened the door .

eng: a name of a person or place, especially a strange one
chisen: 一輩子取那樣一個名字也夠奇怪的！
engsen: That's some handle to go through life with !

eng: A handsome man is physically attractive in a traditional, male way.
chisen: 她夢想自己被一位高大黝黑的英俊陌生男子迷得神魂顛倒。
engsen: Her dream is to be whisked off her feet by a tall , dark , handsome stranger .

eng: large in amount
chisen: 他們利用自己的房子賺了一大筆錢。
engsen: They made a handsome profit on their house .

eng: to fasten or support something at the top leaving the other parts free to move, or to be held in this way
chisen: 把你的大衣和帽子掛在那邊的架子上。
engsen: Hang your coat and hat (up) on the rack over there .

eng: to fasten or support something at the top leaving the other parts free to move, or to be held in this way
chisen: 在烹調雉雞肉之前先把它掛起來晾幾天，這樣味道會更好。
engsen: Hang the pheasant/Let the pheasant hang for a few days for the flavour to improve before you cook it .

eng: to kill someone, especially as punishment for a serious crime, by dropping them with a rope tied around their neck, or to die in this way
chisen: 他被判有罪，並在那年的晚些時候被施以絞刑。
engsen: He was found guilty and hanged later that year .

eng: to kill someone, especially as punishment for a serious crime, by dropping them with a rope tied around their neck, or to die in this way
chisen: 沒有甚麽確鑿的證據證明她有罪，所以很少有人認爲她應該被絞死。
engsen: With so little evidence to prove her guilt , few people thought she should hang .

eng: to kill someone, especially as punishment for a serious crime, by dropping them with a rope tied around their neck, or to die in this way
chisen: 那個女人試圖用一條床單上吊。
engsen: The woman tried to hang herself with a sheet .

eng: to stay in the air
chisen: 獵鷹似乎在空中停了一下才撲向獵物。
engsen: The falcon seemed to hang in the air for a moment before diving onto its prey .

eng: only just; almost not
chisen: 我在後面幾乎聽不見她說甚麽。
engsen: I could hardly hear her at the back .

eng: only just; almost not
chisen: 她離開的時候派對才剛剛開始。
engsen: The party had hardly started when she left .

eng: only just; almost not
chisen: 他幾乎甚麽都沒吃。
engsen: He hardly ate anything/He ate hardly anything .

eng: only just; almost not
chisen: 我們幾乎從不去聽音樂會。
engsen: We hardly ever (= almost never) go to concerts .

eng: only just; almost not
chisen: 沒過一會兒，門就吱扭一聲打開了。
engsen: Hardly had a moment passed before the door creaked open .

eng: certainly not
chisen: 你才剛爲公司工作兩個星期，別指望能加薪。
engsen: You can hardly expect a pay rise when you've only been working for the company for two weeks !

eng: certainly not
chisen: 好啦，別再生我的氣了——下雨又不是我的錯！
engsen: Well don't be angry with me - it's hardly my fault that it's raining !

chi: 令人非常討厭的，可惡的
eng: very unpleasant
chisen: 我從不穿灰色的衣服，因爲那讓我想起了令人討厭的校服。
engsen: I never wear grey because it reminds me of my hateful school uniform .

eng: strong and well
chisen: 她是個正常健康的孩子。
engsen: She's a normal , healthy child .

eng: strong and well
chisen: 他看起來還算健康。
engsen: He looks healthy enough .

eng: successful and strong
chisen: 繁榮的經濟
engsen: a healthy economy

eng: normal and showing good judgment
chisen: 對權威合理的漠視
engsen: a healthy disrespect for authority

eng: a device that produces heat
chisen: 煤氣爐／電加熱器
engsen: a gas/electric heater

eng: the distance from the top to the bottom of something, or the quality of being tall
chisen: 紐約的摩天大樓光高度就氣勢非凡。
engsen: The sheer height of New York's skyscrapers is so impressive .

eng: the distance from the top to the bottom of something, or the quality of being tall
chisen: 她大約中等個子。
engsen: She's about average height (= neither short nor tall) .

chi: 願意幫忙的；有幫助的，有用的
eng: willing to help, or useful
chisen: 她可真是個討人喜歡又樂於助人的孩子！
engsen: She's such a pleasant , helpful child !

chi: 願意幫忙的；有幫助的，有用的
eng: willing to help, or useful
chisen: 真抱歉，我只是想幫忙。
engsen: I'm sorry , I was only trying to be helpful .

chi: 願意幫忙的；有幫助的，有用的
eng: willing to help, or useful
chisen: 他提了幾個很有幫助的建議。
engsen: He made several helpful suggestions .

chi: （尤用來稱呼自己喜歡的）姑娘
eng: used as a way of talking to a woman or girl, especially a friend
chisen: ｢你不舒服嗎，小姑娘？｣
engsen: Are you not feeling too good , hen ?

eng: a person who is admired for having done something very brave or having achieved something great
chisen: 戰鬥英雄
engsen: a war hero

eng: a person who is admired for having done something very brave or having achieved something great
chisen: 他因在革命中所扮演的角色而成為民族英雄。
engsen: He became a national hero for his part in the revolution .

eng: a person who is admired for having done something very brave or having achieved something great
chisen: 格雷厄姆說他會在淩晨四點送我父母去機場——他真是個英雄！
engsen: Graham says he'll take my parents to the airport at four o'clock in the morning - what a hero !

eng: to put something or someone in a place where that thing or person cannot be seen or found, or to put yourself somewhere where you cannot be seen or found
chisen: 她過去常把自己的日記藏在枕頭下。
engsen: She used to hide her diary under her pillow .

eng: to put something or someone in a place where that thing or person cannot be seen or found, or to put yourself somewhere where you cannot be seen or found
chisen: 我喜歡戴太陽眼鏡——我覺得我可以躲在鏡片後面。
engsen: I like wearing sunglasses - I feel I can hide behind them .

chi: 公路（尤指連接城鎮的重要公路）
eng: a public road, especially an important road that joins cities or towns together
chisen: 濱海／州際公路
engsen: a coastal/interstate highway

eng: the area below the waist and above the legs at either side of the body, or the joint that connects the leg to the upper part of the body
chisen: 這套運動是為了使你的臀部和腹部變得苗條而設計的。
engsen: This exercise is designed to trim your hips and stomach .

eng: the area below the waist and above the legs at either side of the body, or the joint that connects the leg to the upper part of the body
chisen: 這條裙子臀部有點緊。
engsen: The skirt was a bit tight across the hips .

eng: to pay to use something for a short period
chisen: 租一輛車週末用要多少錢？
engsen: How much would it cost to hire a car for the weekend ?

eng: to pay to use something for a short period
chisen: 如果你買不起舞會禮服，起碼可以租一套。
engsen: You could always hire a dress for the ball if you can't afford to buy one .

eng: an activity that someone does for pleasure when they are not working
chisen: 安吉拉的業餘愛好是修復舊型機車。
engsen: Angela's hobby is restoring vintage motorcycles .

eng: a device for putting objects in or for keeping them in place
chisen: 牙刷架
engsen: a toothbrush holder

eng: a device for putting objects in or for keeping them in place
chisen: 煙嘴
engsen: a cigarette holder

eng: someone who officially owns something
chisen: 帳戶／執照／護照持有人
engsen: an account/licence/passport holder

eng: someone who officially owns something
chisen: 公司的股東有多種收益。
engsen: Holders of shares in the company receive various benefits .

eng: unhappy because of being away from home for a long period
chisen: 我在讀媽媽的來信時開始覺得越來越想家。
engsen: As I read my mother's letter , I began to feel more and more homesick .

eng: telling the truth or able to be trusted and not likely to steal, cheat, or lie
chisen: 她很誠實。
engsen: She's completely honest .

eng: telling the truth or able to be trusted and not likely to steal, cheat, or lie
chisen: 我希望你給我一個誠實的回答／坦誠的意見。
engsen: I'd like you to give me an honest answer/your honest opinion .

eng: telling the truth or able to be trusted and not likely to steal, cheat, or lie
chisen: 他看起來忠厚可信。
engsen: He had an honest face (= he looked like he could be trusted) .

eng: telling the truth or able to be trusted and not likely to steal, cheat, or lie
chisen: （跟你）說老實話，我認為那根本不可能。
engsen: To be honest (with you) , I don't think it will be possible .

eng: a sweet, sticky, yellow substance made by bees and used as food
chisen: 凝固的／稀軟的蜂蜜
engsen: set honey/runny honey

eng: a name that you call someone you love or like very much
chisen: 嗨，親愛的，我回來了！
engsen: Hi , honey , I'm home !

eng: to jump on one foot or to move about in this way
chisen: 我抓住吉姆，並用我那隻好腳努力向前跳。
engsen: I tried to hop on my good foot while holding onto Jim .

eng: a place where people who are ill or injured are treated and taken care of by doctors and nurses
chisen: 綜合／兒童／婦產醫院
engsen: a general/children's/maternity hospital

eng: a place where people who are ill or injured are treated and taken care of by doctors and nurses
chisen: 我不得不接受手術。
engsen: I've got to go (in)to hospital (US to the hospital) to have an operation .

eng: a place where people who are ill or injured are treated and taken care of by doctors and nurses
chisen: 去年她住了一個星期醫院。
engsen: She spent a week in hospital (US in the hospital) last year .

eng: someone who has guests
chisen: 我們感謝主人家讓我們度過了一個愉快的夜晚。
engsen: We thanked our hosts for a very enjoyable evening .

eng: someone who has guests
chisen: 當地的語言學校正在招募能接待外國訪客的家庭。
engsen: The local language school is advertising for host families (= families people stay with when they are visiting another country) .

eng: a person who introduces guests and performers, especially on television or radio
chisen: 我們今晚節目的主持人是吉米·法倫。
engsen: Our host for tonight's show is Jimmy Fallon .

eng: a place or organization that provides the space and other necessary things for a special event
chisen: 日本將主辦下一次國際會議。
engsen: Japan is playing host to the next international conference .

eng: a place or organization that provides the space and other necessary things for a special event
chisen: 下屆世界盃的主辦國
engsen: the host nation for the next World Cup

eng: a large number of something
chisen: 有一大堆理由可以解釋他為甚麼沒有得到那份工作。
engsen: There's a whole host of reasons why he didn't get the job .

eng: a building where you pay to have a room to sleep in, and where you can sometimes eat meals
chisen: 四星級飯店
engsen: a four-star hotel

eng: a building where you pay to have a room to sleep in, and where you can sometimes eat meals
chisen: 克拉倫登飯店
engsen: the Clarendon Hotel

eng: a building where you pay to have a room to sleep in, and where you can sometimes eat meals
chisen: 我們住在一家濱海飯店。
engsen: We stayed in/at a hotel on the beach .

eng: despite whatever amount or degree
chisen: 無論有多餓，我似乎都吃不下一整個披薩。
engsen: However hungry I am , I never seem to be able to finish off a whole pizza .

eng: despite whatever amount or degree
chisen: 如果艾瑪喜歡某個東西，無論多貴她都會買。
engsen: If Emma likes something she'll buy it however much it costs .

eng: despite whatever amount or degree
chisen: 演出結束後我們再見面，我會給你20英鎊或者是實際的門票錢。
engsen: I'll see you after the show and give you £20 for the tickets , or however much (= whatever) they cost .

chi: （用於表示驚訝）究竟怎樣，到底如何
eng: used to express surprise
chisen: 你究竟是怎樣設法讓他同意的？
engsen: However did you manage to get him to agree to that ?

eng: despite this
chisen: 這是問題其中一種可能的解決之道，但還有其他的辦法。
engsen: This is one possible solution to the problem . However , there are others .

eng: despite this
chisen: 然而，可能還有其他我們不知道的原因。
engsen: There may , however , be other reasons that we don't know about .

chi: 發出連續低沉的聲音，嗡嗡作響
eng: to make a continuous low sound
chisen: 電腦在背景中嗡嗡作響。
engsen: The computers were humming in the background .

chi: 發出連續低沉的聲音，嗡嗡作響
eng: to make a continuous low sound
chisen: 那種奇怪的嗡嗡聲是甚麼？
engsen: What's that strange humming sound ?

eng: not proud or not believing that you are important
chisen: 他對自己的成功十分謙虛。
engsen: He's very humble about his success .

eng: not proud or not believing that you are important
chisen: 出現這樣的差錯，請接受我們真誠的道歉。
engsen: Please accept our humble apologies for the error .

eng: not proud or not believing that you are important
chisen: 依愚見，首先我們就不應該買這輛汽車。
engsen: In my humble opinion (= I want to emphasize that I think that) we should never have bought the car in the first place .

chi: （空氣和天氣狀況）潮濕的，濕潤的
eng: (of air and weather conditions) containing extremely small drops of water in the air
chisen: 紐約的夏天炎熱潮濕。
engsen: New York is very hot and humid in the summer .

chi: （空氣和天氣狀況）潮濕的，濕潤的
eng: (of air and weather conditions) containing extremely small drops of water in the air
chisen: 炎熱而潮濕的氣候
engsen: a hot and humid climate

eng: the feeling you have when you need to eat
chisen: 我無法相信那麼豐富的飯菜也不能填飽你的肚子。
engsen: I can't believe that that enormous meal wasn't enough to satisfy your hunger .

eng: the feeling you have when you need to eat
chisen: 九點的時候，她開始餓到有點頭暈。
engsen: By about nine o'clock she started to feel faint from/with hunger .

eng: the feeling you have when you need to eat
chisen: 下午三點左右，我經常會感到陣陣饑餓。
engsen: I often suffer from hunger pangs (= strong feelings of needing something to eat) in the middle of the afternoon .

eng: a strong wish or desire
chisen: 對冒險／知識／成功的渴望
engsen: a hunger for adventure/knowledge/success

eng: to chase and try to catch and kill an animal or bird for food, sport, or profit
chisen: 有些動物在夜間獵食。
engsen: Some animals hunt at night .

eng: to chase and try to catch and kill an animal or bird for food, sport, or profit
chisen: 在幼獅的小時候，母獅會守在它身旁，而雄獅去覓食。
engsen: When lion cubs are young , the mother stays with them while the father hunts for food .

eng: to chase and try to catch and kill an animal or bird for food, sport, or profit
chisen: 傑克和查理喜歡在週末去打獵。
engsen: Jack and Charlie like to hunt/go hunting (= chase and kill animals for sport) at weekends .

eng: to chase and try to catch and kill an animal or bird for food, sport, or profit
chisen: 貓喜歡捕食老鼠和鳥類。
engsen: Cats like to hunt mice and birds .

eng: to chase and try to catch and kill an animal or bird for food, sport, or profit
chisen: 以前人們經常為了得到象牙而捕獵大象。
engsen: Elephants used to be hunted for the ivory from their tusks .

eng: to try to find something or someone
chisen: 我在這個地方找了好幾次，卻找也找不到那本書。
engsen: I've hunted all over the place , but I can't find that book .

eng: to try to find something or someone
chisen: 他們仍在搜尋那個失蹤的孩子。
engsen: They are still hunting for the missing child .

eng: to try to find something or someone
chisen: 我已經四處找過我的手套。

eng: good

eng: clever and simple

eng: (of a strong alcoholic drink) without anything, such as water or ice or another drink, added to it

engsen: She likes her whisky neat .

eng: needed in order to achieve a particular result

engsen: He lacks the necessary skills for the job .

eng: needed in order to achieve a particular result

engsen: I don't have much time so I won't be staying any longer than necessary .

eng: needed in order to achieve a particular result

engsen: Just do what's necessary and then leave .

eng: needed in order to achieve a particular result

engsen: If necessary , we can always change the dates of our trip .

eng: needed in order to achieve a particular result

eng: a thin metal pin, used in sewing, that is pointed at one end and has a hole called an eye at the other end for thread

eng: a thin metal pin, used in sewing, that is pointed at one end and has a hole called an eye at the other end for thread

engsen: Here , your eyes are better than mine - could you thread (= put thread through) this needle for me ?

engsen: It sounds like the needle on your record player needs to be replaced .

engsen: You're so negative about everything !

engsen: On two occasions she was accused of stealing money from the company , but in neither case was there any evidence to support the claims .

chi: （鳥類或昆蟲的）窩，巢；（某些動物的）穴

engsen: With two houses , three cars and child-support payments , he just couldn't meet his nut , even with a second job .

engsen: a collection of precious objects

engsen: In the sentence "I like ice cream" , "ice cream" is the object of the verb "like" .

chi: 主動給予；主動提出；提議

chi: 主動給予；主動提出；提議

engsen: It's an organization that offers free legal advice to people on low incomes .

engsen: It says in the guide that this area offers some of the best walks in England .

eng: to provide or supply something

engsen: It doesn't have much to offer as a town - its shops are fairly poor and there's only one cinema .

eng: relating to a position of responsibility

engsen: The Prince's tour conveniently omitted the most deprived areas of the city .

engsen: How do you operate the remote control unit ?

engsen: Does the company operate a pension scheme ?

engsen: Changes are being introduced to make the department operate more efficiently .

chi: （使）工作，（使）運行；運作；操作；起作用

engsen: Specially equipped troops are operating in the hills .

engsen: We have representatives operating in most countries .

engsen: clothing that protects you against the cold

chi: （科學實驗或醫學檢查的）結果
eng: the information you get from something such as a scientific experiment or medical test
chisen: 民意調查結果顯示，大多數女性支援這一行動。
engsen: The results of the opinion poll showed that most women supported this action .

eng: the answer to a calculation in mathematics
chisen: 我們倆用了不同的計算方法，但是得出的結果都一樣。
engsen: We used different methods of calculation , but we both got the same result .

chi: （選舉的）結果；（比賽的）成績，比分
eng: the score or number of votes, showing the success or failure of the people involved, in a sports competition, election, etc.
chisen: 地方選舉結果
engsen: the results of the local elections

chi: （選舉的）結果；（比賽的）成績，比分
eng: the score or number of votes, showing the success or failure of the people involved, in a sports competition, election, etc.
chisen: 足球比賽的比分
engsen: the football results

chi: （選舉的）結果；（比賽的）成績，比分
eng: the score or number of votes, showing the success or failure of the people involved, in a sports competition, election, etc.
chisen: 我們期望贏得比賽，所以平局的結果令我們失望。
engsen: We were expecting to win , so a draw was a disappointing result for us .

chi: （公司在某一階段的銷售、利潤等的）成績
eng: the amount of a company's sales, profit, etc. during a particular period
chisen: 航空公司報告第一季度財務成績顯著改善。
engsen: Airlines reported significantly better financial results for the first quarter .

eng: to think or talk about something again, in order to make changes to it or to make a decision about it
chisen: 委員會正在審查目前的安排／研究當前的形勢。
engsen: The committee is reviewing the current arrangement/situation .

eng: to think or talk about something again, in order to make changes to it or to make a decision about it
chisen: 我們談談到目前為止發生的事情吧。
engsen: Let's review what has happened so far .

eng: to think or talk about something again, in order to make changes to it or to make a decision about it
chisen: 他在最後作出決定之前，對各種選擇進行了斟酌權衡。
engsen: He reviewed his options before making a final decision .

eng: If critics review a book, play, film, etc. they write their opinion of it.
chisen: 我只去看那些獲得好評的電影。
engsen: I only go to see films that are reviewed favourably .

eng: When an important person reviews military forces, they formally visitand look at them.
chisen: 在最近的訪問中，女王檢閱了部隊。
engsen: The Queen reviewed the troops on her recent visit .

eng: to study again something you have already learned, in preparation for an exam
chisen: 我們正在為明天的（代數）考試進行複習。
engsen: We're reviewing (algebra) for the test tomorrow .

eng: a large amount of money or valuable possessions
chisen: 她將很大一部分財産捐給了兒童慈善機構。
engsen: She donated a sizeable portion of her riches to children's charities .

eng: the dry solid part of the earth's surface, or any large piece of this that sticks up out of the ground or the sea
chisen: 山和懸崖都是由岩石構成的。
engsen: Mountains and cliffs are formed from rock .

eng: the dry solid part of the earth's surface, or any large piece of this that sticks up out of the ground or the sea
chisen: 船在海灣外撞上了一塊礁石，沉沒了。
engsen: The boat struck a rock outside the bay and sank .

eng: a type of popular music with a strong, loud beat that is usually played with electric guitars and drums
chisen: 搖滾樂團
engsen: a rock group

eng: a type of popular music with a strong, loud beat that is usually played with electric guitars and drums
chisen: 搖滾歌星
engsen: a rock star

chi: 岩石構成的，多岩石的；崎嶇難行的
eng: made of rock and therefore usually rough and difficult to travel along
chisen: 她沿著一條崎嶇的小道攀爬。
engsen: She scrambled along the rocky path .

chi: 身體搖搖晃晃的；頭暈目眩的
eng: unable to balance very well
chisen: 住院臥床兩個月後，我感到走路有點搖搖晃晃的。
engsen: After two months in a hospital bed , I felt a bit rocky on my feet .

eng: the position or purpose that someone or something has in a situation, organization, society, or relationship
chisen: 他在這個工程中負責甚麽？
engsen: What is his role in this project ?

eng: the position or purpose that someone or something has in a situation, organization, society, or relationship
chisen: 學校在社會中起著非常重要的作用。
engsen: Schools play an important role in society .

eng: the position or purpose that someone or something has in a situation, organization, society, or relationship
chisen: 六人因為參與反政府示威遊行而受審。
engsen: Six people have been put on trial for their role (= involvement) in the anti-government demonstrations .

eng: an actor's part in a film or play
chisen: 她在學校的戲劇表演中擔當主角／配角。
engsen: She's got a leading/supporting role in the school play .

eng: an actor's part in a film or play
chisen: 她扮演一個奸詐的律師。
engsen: She plays the role of a crooked lawyer .

eng: belonging or connected to a king or queen or a member of their family
chisen: 王室
engsen: the royal family

eng: belonging or connected to a king or queen or a member of their family
chisen: 國王（或女王）的來訪
engsen: a royal visit

chi: 不禮貌的；粗魯的，粗野的；討厭的
eng: not polite; offensive or embarrassing
chisen: 他這人很粗魯。
engsen: He's a very rude man .

chi: 不禮貌的；粗魯的，粗野的；討厭的
eng: not polite; offensive or embarrassing
chisen: 別人給你東西，你不說「謝謝」是不禮貌的。
engsen: It's rude not to say "Thank you" when you are given something .

chi: 不禮貌的；粗魯的，粗野的；討厭的
eng: not polite; offensive or embarrassing
chisen: 他這人很無禮——他對誰都很粗魯。
engsen: He's got no manners - he's rude to everyone .

chi: 突如其來的；突兀的；令人不知所措的；猛烈的
eng: sudden and unpleasant
chisen: 看到我們的電話話費單時我們好像當頭挨了一棒。
engsen: We had a rude awakening (= unpleasant shock) when we saw our phone bill .

eng: simply and roughly made
chisen: 我們用石塊在海灘上壘了一個簡易棚。
engsen: We built a rude shelter from rocks on the beach .

eng: the leader of a country
chisen: 女王死後，這個國家陷入了無人統治的狀態。
engsen: The country was without a ruler after the queen died .

chi: 奔跑的人；（尤指）參加賽跑的人
eng: someone who runs, especially in competitions
chisen: 長跑運動員
engsen: a long-distance runner

chi: （使）急速行進；（使）趕緊；（使）倉促行事；（使）急速做
eng: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly
chisen: 我忙了整整一天，想把所有的事情都做完。
engsen: I've been rushing (about/around) all day trying to get everything done .

chi: （使）急速行進；（使）趕緊；（使）倉促行事；（使）急速做
eng: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly
chisen: 我飛奔上樓梯／匆匆趕到辦公室／趕忙去找電話。
engsen: I rushed up the stairs/to the office/to find a phone .

chi: （使）急速行進；（使）趕緊；（使）倉促行事；（使）急速做
eng: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly
chisen: 她把它底朝上翻轉過來時，水一下子傾瀉出來。
engsen: When she turned it upside down the water rushed out .

chi: （使）急速行進；（使）趕緊；（使）倉促行事；（使）急速做
eng: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly
chisen: 我們不應該不問青紅皂白就責備他們。
engsen: We shouldn't rush to blame them .

chi: （使）急速行進；（使）趕緊；（使）倉促行事；（使）急速做
eng: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly
chisen: 你不應該這樣草草趕工。
engsen: You can't rush a job like this .

chi: （使）急速行進；（使）趕緊；（使）倉促行事；（使）急速做
eng: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly
chisen: 應急法案在一個上午就被議會快速通過了。
engsen: The emergency legislation was rushed through Parliament in a morning .

chi: （使）急速行進；（使）趕緊；（使）倉促行事；（使）急速做
eng: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly
chisen: 別催我！
engsen: Don't rush me !

chi: （使）急速行進；（使）趕緊；（使）倉促行事；（使）急速做
eng: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly
chisen: 聯合國向發生饑荒的地區緊急提供了醫療和食品援助。
engsen: The United Nations has rushed medical aid and food to the famine zone .

chi: （使）急速行進；（使）趕緊；（使）倉促行事；（使）急速做
eng: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly
chisen: 他催趕著孩子們快點出門去學校，以免遲到。
engsen: He rushed the children off to school so they wouldn't be late .

chi: 一起向…發起突襲；猛攻；向…猛衝
eng: If a group of people rush an enemy or the place where an enemy is, they attack suddenly and all together.
chisen: 我們一起衝向宮殿大門，殺死了守衛。
engsen: We rushed the palace gates and killed the guards .

eng: a state in which or a place where you are safe and not in danger or at risk
chisen: 爲了您的（舒適和）安全，我們建議您在飛行期間鬆鬆地繫住安全帶。
engsen: For your (comfort and) safety , we recommend you keep your seat belt loosely fastened during the flight .

eng: a state in which or a place where you are safe and not in danger or at risk
chisen: 記者可以進入危險地帶，但遺憾的是，我們不能確保他們的安全。
engsen: Reporters may enter the danger zone but unfortunately we cannot guarantee/assure their safety .

eng: a state in which or a place where you are safe and not in danger or at risk
chisen: 全體船員被救援直升機吊運至安全的地方。
engsen: The crew of the ship were winched to safety by a rescue helicopter .

eng: a state in which or a place where you are safe and not in danger or at risk
chisen: 持槍歹徒一開火，他們全都跑／衝到樹後以保安全。
engsen: As the gunman opened fire , they all ran/dived for safety behind the trees .

eng: a state in which or a place where you are safe and not in danger or at risk
chisen: 警方爲那個五歲小孩的安危擔心。
engsen: Police are concerned for the safety of (= think that something bad might have happened to) the five-year-old .

eng: a state in which or a place where you are safe and not in danger or at risk
chisen: 他被帶往一個安全的地方。
engsen: He was led to a place of safety (= somewhere he would not be in danger , especially of being found and harmed) .

chi: （通常用生菜等做成的）蔬菜沙拉
eng: a mixture of uncooked vegetables, usually including lettuce, eaten either as a separate dish or with other food
chisen: 用油醋醬調味料拌沙拉。
engsen: Toss (= mix) the salad with a vinaigrette dressing .

chi: （通常用生菜等做成的）蔬菜沙拉
eng: a mixture of uncooked vegetables, usually including lettuce, eaten either as a separate dish or with other food
chisen: 用什錦沙拉配義大利燉飯。
engsen: Serve the risotto with a mixed/green salad .

chi: （通常用生菜等做成的）蔬菜沙拉
eng: a mixture of uncooked vegetables, usually including lettuce, eaten either as a separate dish or with other food
chisen: 沙拉碗
engsen: a salad bowl

eng: tasting of salt
chisen: 這種熏肉對我來說太鹹了。
engsen: This bacon is too salty for me .

eng: a small amount of something that shows you what the rest is or should be like
chisen: 免費的洗髮精試用包
engsen: a free sample of shampoo

eng: a small amount of something that shows you what the rest is or should be like
chisen: 地毯／窗簾材料的樣品
engsen: samples of carpet/curtain material

eng: a small amount of something that shows you what the rest is or should be like
chisen: 請帶一些你的作品範本去面試。
engsen: Please bring some samples of your work to the interview .

eng: two pieces of bread with cheese, salad, or meat, usually cold, between them
chisen: 鮪魚／火腿三明治
engsen: a tuna/ham sandwich

eng: two pieces of bread with cheese, salad, or meat, usually cold, between them
chisen: 烤三明治
engsen: a toasted sandwich

eng: two pieces of bread with cheese, salad, or meat, usually cold, between them
chisen: 三明治速食店／亭
engsen: a sandwich bar/box

eng: to please someone by giving them what they want or need
chisen: 他們有31種口味的霜淇淋——足以滿足所有人！
engsen: They have 31 flavours of ice cream - enough to satisfy everyone !

eng: to please someone by giving them what they want or need
chisen: 來，滿足一下我的好奇心，昨天晚上發生了甚麽事？
engsen: Come on , satisfy my curiosity (= tell me what I want to know) - what happened last night ?

eng: to make someone believe that something is true
chisen: 法庭接受了他的解釋。
engsen: His explanation satisfied the court .

eng: to make someone believe that something is true
chisen: 我確定自己已經鎖門了。
engsen: I satisfied myself (that) I had locked the door .

eng: to make someone believe that something is true
chisen: 當局相信他的處境很危急。
engsen: The authorities were satisfied of (= they accepted) the seriousness of his situation .

eng: a thick liquid eaten with food to add flavour
chisen: 鹹／甜醬汁
engsen: a savoury/sweet sauce

eng: remarks that are rude or show no respect
chisen: 你無禮的話說夠了吧，我的小姐！
engsen: That's enough of your sauce , my girl !

chi: 科學；自然科學；科學知識
eng: (knowledge from) the careful study of the structure and behaviour of the physical world, especially by watching, measuring, and doing experiments, and the development of theories to describe the results of these activities
chisen: 科學技術的最新發展
engsen: recent developments in science and technology

chi: 科學；自然科學；科學知識
eng: (knowledge from) the careful study of the structure and behaviour of the physical world, especially by watching, measuring, and doing experiments, and the development of theories to describe the results of these activities
chisen: 太空漫遊是現代科學的一大奇蹟。
engsen: Space travel is one of the marvels/wonders of modern science .

eng: an expert who studies or works in one of the sciences
chisen: 研究型／核子科學家
engsen: a research/nuclear scientist

eng: a device used for cutting materials such as paper, cloth, and hair, consisting of two sharp blades that are joined in the middle, and two handles with holes to put your fingers through
chisen: 一把剪刀
engsen: a pair of scissors

eng: a device used for cutting materials such as paper, cloth, and hair, consisting of two sharp blades that are joined in the middle, and two handles with holes to put your fingers through
chisen: 請你把那把剪刀遞給我，好嗎？
engsen: Could you pass me the/those scissors , please ?

eng: to win or get a point, goal, etc. in a competition, sport, game, or test
chisen: 坦南特在比賽的最後一分鐘進了一球。
engsen: Tennant scored (a goal) in the last minute of the game .

eng: to win or get a point, goal, etc. in a competition, sport, game, or test
chisen: 在美式橄欖球中，攻方持球觸地就得六分。
engsen: In American football , a touchdown scores (= is worth) six points .

eng: to win or get a point, goal, etc. in a competition, sport, game, or test
chisen: 拼寫考試滿分20分，她得了18分。
engsen: She scored 18 out of 20 in the spelling test .

eng: to get something
chisen: 我設法弄到了幾張世界盃決賽的入場券。
engsen: I managed to score a couple of tickets to the World Cup final .

eng: to make a mark or cut on the surface of something hard with a pointed tool, or to draw a line through writing
chisen: 要是先在瓷磚上劃一道痕，要破開就容易多了。
engsen: If you score the tile first , it will be easier to break .

eng: to write or change a piece of music for particular instruments or voices
chisen: 這是爲弦樂和木管樂寫的總譜。
engsen: This piece is scored for strings and woodwind .

eng: a flat surface in a cinema, on a television, or as part of a computer, on which pictures or words are shown
chisen: 我們的電視螢幕是19吋的。
engsen: Our television has a 19-inch screen .

eng: a flat surface in a cinema, on a television, or as part of a computer, on which pictures or words are shown
chisen: 請馬上來電影院欣賞《羅賓漢歷險記》吧。
engsen: Coming to your screens (= cinemas) shortly , "The Adventures of Robin Hood" .

eng: a flat surface in a cinema, on a television, or as part of a computer, on which pictures or words are shown
chisen: 她的理想是給電影、電視寫劇本。
engsen: Her ambition is to write for the screen (= for television and films) .

eng: a flat surface in a cinema, on a television, or as part of a computer, on which pictures or words are shown
chisen: 用電腦寫信，你可以很輕易地在螢幕上作修改。
engsen: Write the letter on the computer , then you can make changes easily on screen .

eng: a vertical structure that is used to separate one area from another, especially to hide something or to protect you from something unpleasant or dangerous
chisen: 護士在病人床邊拉上了屏風，使醫生可以單獨爲病人檢查。
engsen: The nurse pulled a screen around the bed so that the doctor could examine the patient in private .

eng: a vertical structure that is used to separate one area from another, especially to hide something or to protect you from something unpleasant or dangerous
chisen: 花園盡頭的一排樹木把工廠難看的外牆遮住了。
engsen: A screen of trees at the bottom of the garden hid the ugly factory walls .

eng: to look somewhere carefully in order to find something
chisen: 員警在樹林中搜尋失蹤的男孩。
engsen: The police searched the woods for the missing boy .

eng: to look somewhere carefully in order to find something
chisen: 她仔細端詳他的臉，想看出些許表示原諒的神情，但他臉上仍然毫無表情。
engsen: She searched his face for some sign of forgiveness , but it remained expressionless .

eng: to look somewhere carefully in order to find something
chisen: 他翻遍口袋想找些零錢。
engsen: He searched (in/through) his pockets for some change .

eng: to look somewhere carefully in order to find something
chisen: 我到處找，卻怎麽也找不到我的出生證明。
engsen: I've searched high and low (= everywhere) , but I can't find my birth certificate .

eng: to look somewhere carefully in order to find something
chisen: 偵探在屋子裡到處搜尋，但失竊物品仍不見蹤影。
engsen: The detectives searched the house from top to bottom (= all over it) , but they found no sign of the stolen goods .

eng: to look somewhere carefully in order to find something
chisen: 她拼命想記起這個男人的名字，但怎麽也想不起來。
engsen: She searched her mind/memory for the man's name , but she couldn't remember it .

eng: to look somewhere carefully in order to find something
chisen: 想要尋求內心平和的人有時會求助於宗教。
engsen: People who are searching after inner peace sometimes turn to religion .

eng: a piece of information that is only known by one person or a few people and should not be told to others
chisen: 你爲甚麽一定要跑去把我生病的事告訴鮑勃？你就是不能保守秘密，是嗎？
engsen: Why did you have to go and tell Bob about my illness ? You just can't keep a secret , can you ?

eng: a piece of information that is only known by one person or a few people and should not be told to others
chisen: 關係親密的夫妻之間應該是沒有秘密的。
engsen: A close couple should have no secrets from each other .

eng: a piece of information that is only known by one person or a few people and should not be told to others
chisen: 難道你不打算告訴我這個秘密？
engsen: Aren't you going to let me in on (= tell me) the secret ?

eng: a piece of information that is only known by one person or a few people and should not be told to others
chisen: 他是同性戀，這已不是秘密了。
engsen: There's no secret (= everyone knows) about his homosexuality .

eng: a piece of information that is only known by one person or a few people and should not be told to others
chisen: 她毫不掩飾自己對父親的反感。
engsen: She makes no secret of (= makes very clear) her dislike of her father .

eng: a piece of information that is only known by one person or a few people and should not be told to others
chisen: 那個餐廳是羅馬最鮮爲人知的地方之一。
engsen: That restaurant is one of the best-kept secrets in Rome .

eng: someone who works in an office, writing letters, making phone calls, and arranging meetings for a person or for an organization
chisen: 我的秘書會打電話給你安排會議。
engsen: My secretary will phone you to arrange a meeting .

eng: the member of a committee of an organization, club, etc. who keeps records of meetings, sends letters, emails, etc.
chisen: 委員會內有三個通過競選得到的職位：主席、秘書和財務主管。
engsen: The three elected members of the committee are the chair , secretary , and treasurer .

chi: （負責機構整體管理的）幹事，文書
eng: an official who has responsibility for the general management of an organization
chisen: 公司的文書已就這個錯誤向所有股東寫信致歉了。
engsen: The company secretary has written to all the shareholders to apologize for the mistake .

eng: one of the parts that something is divided into
chisen: 報紙的體育版
engsen: the sports section of the newspaper

eng: one of the parts that something is divided into
chisen: 飛機的尾部
engsen: the tail section of an aircraft

eng: one of the parts that something is divided into
chisen: 這個餐館有禁煙區嗎？
engsen: Does the restaurant have a non-smoking section ?

eng: one of the parts that something is divided into
chisen: 該社區最窮的居民健康狀況糟糕得多。
engsen: The poorest sections of the community have much worse health .

eng: one of the parts that something is divided into
chisen: 他被控違反了《槍械法》第17款。
engsen: He was charged under section 17 of the Firearms Act (= according to that part of the law) .

eng: to choose a small number of things, or to choose by making careful decisions
chisen: 有四種獎品可供選擇，獲勝者可以從中挑選一個。
engsen: There was a choice of four prizes , and the winner could select one of them .

eng: to choose a small number of things, or to choose by making careful decisions
chisen: 滑鼠這種工具能夠使人更方便快捷地從電腦功能表中選擇不同的選項。
engsen: A mouse is a device which makes it easier to select different options from computer menus .

eng: to choose a small number of things, or to choose by making careful decisions

engsen: "The tickets are €40 each." "Well , that settles that - I can't afford that much."

an 
electric shock

chi: 開（槍），射（箭）；發射；射中，射傷，射殺

eng: to write your name, usually on a written or printed document, to show that you agree with its contents or have written or created it yourself

engsen: He signed himself "Mark Taylor" .

eng: to write your name, usually on a written or printed document, to show that you agree with its contents or have written or created it yourself

engsen: As rock musicians in the 1960s , they were very much part of the spirit of the age/times .

chi: （使）展開，（使）鋪開；（使）蔓延，（使）擴散

eng: strongly limiting someone's freedom to behave as they wish, or likely to severely punish someone if they do not obey

chi: （用於人名前）稱號，稱謂，頭銜，職稱

engsen: What's her title - is she Professor or Doctor ?

chi: （用於人名前）稱號，稱謂，頭銜，職稱

chi: （用於人名前）稱號，稱謂，頭銜，職稱

engsen: If you wish to sell the property , you will first have to prove your title to it .

engsen: Now , if you'd all please raise your glasses , I'd like to propose a toast to the bride and groom .

eng: an expression of good wishes or respect for someone that involves holding up and then drinking from a glass of alcohol, especially wine, after a short speech

eng: a visit to a place or area, especially one during which you look around the place or area and learn about it

chi: 塔；建築物的塔形部分；塔樓，高樓

eng: a type of path or road, often in the shape of a ring, that has been specially designed and built for sports events, especially racing

engsen: Fireworks have long been an American tradition on the Fourth of July .

eng: to make a journey, usually over a long distance

engsen: I don't know what I'd have done without Lizzie when I was ill - she was an absolute treasure .

eng: to behave towards someone or deal with something in a particular way

engsen: My parents treated us all the same when we were kids .

eng: to behave towards someone or deal with something in a particular way

engsen: He treated his wife very badly .

engsen: It's wrong to treat animals as if they had no feelings .

engsen: You can have the equipment on a trial basis (UK also on trial) , and if you don't like it you can give it back .

eng: a person or thing that is annoying and causes a lot of problems
chisen: 她年輕時真令父母頭痛。
engsen: She was a real trial to her parents when she was younger .

chi: 惹麻煩的人；令人傷腦筋的事物；考驗

engsen: The book is all about the trials of growing up .

eng: an exam taken at school for practice before a real exam

engsen: It's trick photography - she's supposed to look like she's walking on water .

eng: an effective or quick way of doing something

engsen: If she leaves her hair to dry on its own , it just waves naturally .

eng: any object used in fighting or war, such as a gun, bomb, knife, etc.

eng: a circular object connected at the centre to a bar, used for making vehicles or parts of machines move

eng: to speak very quietly, using the breath but not the voice, so that only the person close to you can hear you

chi: （足球、曲棍球等集體項目的）側翼位置，側翼隊員，邊鋒隊員

eng: a piece of thin metal thread that can be bent, used for fastening things and for making particular types of objects that are strong but can bend

eng: having or showing the ability to make good judgments, based on a deep understanding and experience of life

eng: having or showing the ability to make good judgments, based on a deep understanding and experience of life

engsen: Was it Thomas More who said that the wise man learns from the experience of others ?

eng: inside or not further than an area or period of time

engsen: Two thirds of Californians live within 15 miles of the coast .

engsen: Within hours of the tragedy happening , an emergency rescue team had been assembled .

eng: inside or not further than an area or period of time

engsen: He went without my knowledge .

eng: not having or doing something, or lacking something

engsen: She's strong without being bossy .

eng: not having or doing something, or lacking something

engsen: He's not without (= he does have some) good qualities .

engsen: This is without a doubt (= certainly) the best Chinese food I've ever had .

engsen: He's starting to wonder whether he did the right thing in accepting this job .

engsen: "Have you decided where you're going next summer?" "I've been wondering about (= considering) going to Florida."
